loans.name: Erliza

texts.en: Erliza makes a living through her gasoline retailing business. The 38-year-old married mother of four is in business selling gasoline to the people in her place in Leyte, Philippines. Erliza needs a loan to buy more gasoline to sell. This loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a 57-year-old sari-sari store owner from Leyte. She has two grown children. She has been in the business for than five years now.

Fe wants to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, candies, snack foods, and condiments.

This loan will help Fe in improving her stock of goods to sell, thus attracting more buyers into her store. Fe hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, candies, snack foods, and condiments

loans.name: Jenneth

texts.en:
Jenneth is a dried fish vendor from Dulag, Leyte. She is married, and has three children. Jenneth has been in the business for more than 4 years. 

Jenneth is asking for a loan to buy more dried fish to sell to her customers. A loan will help her improve her business, as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 56-year-old married woman, and a sari-sari store owner, from Leyte. For more than 10 years this business has provided her the income that she needs. 

Teresita would like to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, candies, snack foods, and condiments. This loan will help Teresita to improve the stock in her store, thus attracting more buyers. Teresita hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, candies, snack foods, and condiments

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 64 years old and has six adult children. She is from Leyte, Philippines. Estelita is engaged in the hog raising business, which she has been doing for more than five years.  

Estelita is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. This loan will help her to improve her business as well as her income. Estelita hopes to make her business more profitable and stable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 48 years old, married, and has 10 children. She operates a sari-sari store in Leyte, which she has been doing for four years. 

Lilia requested a loan, which she will use to buy more groceries such as canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, bread, biscuits, candies, snack foods, and condiments. This loan will help Lilia to improve her stocks thus attracting more buyers to hers store. She hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, soda,  beverages, soap, toiletries, bread, ,biscuits, candies, snack foods, and condiments

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel raises pigs in her backyard. The mother of four children from Dulag, Leyte, Maribel has raised pigs for more than 20 years now. This is her income. 

Maribel would like to take out a loan to buy more pigs to raise and also animal feed. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise and also animal feed

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando is a 36-year-old farmer from Leyte, Philippines. He has been in the farming business for more than two years now.

Orlando is asking to take a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. A loan will help Orlando in improving the productivity level of his rice farm as well as his income. In the future, Orlando has hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Leonilo

texts.en:
Leonilo is a 34-year-old married man and a father of a three-year-old child. Leonilo has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than 10 years now. 

Leonilo is asking to take out a loan to buy more piglets to raise and also animal feed. A loan will help him improve his business as well as his income.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed for them

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 50-year-old woman and a mother of five children from Leyte, Philippines. Julieta has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than 20 years now. This is her main source of income. 

Julieta is requesting to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed for them. A loan will help her in improving her business as well as her income. Julieta has hopes of making her business more profitable and stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed for them

loans.name: Nelly Cecilia

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de La Dorada desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación de alimentos como gelatinas y jaleas.
Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Nelly y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.

Nelly desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de algunos insumos para continuar realizando sus recetas como azúcar, pata de cerdo (Uno de los ingredientes de las gelatinas tradicionales en Colombia), harina, entre otros.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia, oportunidad que le brinda la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Nelly is a humble, hard-working woman who has spent a large part of her life caring for her children.  She lives in the town of La Dorada where she works as a spectacular cook, preparing foods such as jams and jellies. She sells these foods mostly to the neighbors in her area who know her and know that they will get delicious, well-prepared foods. 

Nelly wants to increase her food sales and work more comfortably, so she is asking for a loan to buy some supplies such as sugar, pigs' feet (an ingredient in traditional Colombian jellies), flour, etc. so she can continue making her recipes.  This loan will allow her to move her business forward and obtain the income necessary for her to continue to support her family, an opportunity being offered to her by Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sugar, pigs' feet, flour, etc.

loans.name: Anatilde

texts.es:
Anatilde es una mujer muy entregada a su trabajo pues a sus 67 años de edad trabaja incasablemente todos los días de la semana de lunes a domingo en su negocio de producción de alimentos típicos como tamales, chorizos y otros. 

Madre de 2 hijos, ve una oportunidad de una entidad que le brinda la confianza de tener un crédito para mejorar su negocio y soñar con su fábrica de producción de alimentos y hacerle creer que es posible alcanzar este sueño. 
Le dedica 6 horas diarias a su negocio.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de ingredientes para sus preparaciones y unas mejoras en su cocina que le permitan trabajar de una mejor manera.

Con la ayuda de este crédito la señora Anatilde producirá mas alimentos podra obtener mejores ingresos para cada día darle mejores oportunidades de vida a sus dos hijos
texts.en:
Anatilde is a woman who is very dedicated to her work, as at 67 years of age she works tirelessly every day of the week from Monday to Sunday in her business producing traditional foods such as tamales, chorizos and other items.

Mother of two children, she sees the opportunity of an organisation that will offer her the confidence to have a loan to improve her business and dream of her own food production factory, and make her believe it is possible to reach this dream. 

She works six hours a day in her business. She is asking for a loan to buy a selection of ingredients for her foods, and make some improvements to her kitchen that will allow her to work in a better way.

With the help of this loan Anatilde will produce more foods, be able to obtain a greater income and be able to give better life opportunities to her two children every day.

loans.use: to buy a selection of ingredients for her foods.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is a 24-year-old father of two children. He is from Talibon, Bohol. He has been running a hog raising business for several years now. This is his source of income.

Gilbert would like to take a loan to buy piglets to raise and to buy animal feed. A loan will help him improve the productivity of his pig raising business. Gilbert dreams of expanding his business in the future in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and to buy animal feed

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca operates a small sari-sari store in her place in Dulag, Leyte. Francisca is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell, like rice, noodles, bread and biscuits, soda and beverages, coffee, sugar, condiments, cooking oil, sanitary napkins and others. A loan will help Francisca to increase her store’s inventory, thus attracting more buyers in her store.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, like rice, noodles, bread and biscuits, soda and beverages, coffee, sugar, condiments, cooking oil, sanitary napkins and others

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 44-year-old sari-sari store owner from Leyte. She has two grown children. She has been in the business around four years now.

Gemma would like to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, candies, snack foods, and condiments.

This loan will help Gemma in improving her stock of goods to sell, thus attracting more buyers in her store. Gemma hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, candies, snack foods, and condiments

loans.name: Charity Grace

texts.en:
Charity Grace is a food vendor from Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has two children. Charity cooks and sells home-cooked foods to the people in her place. This is the source of her income. 

Charity Grace is asking to take out a loan to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice, cooking oil and condiments, among others. Through this loan, Charity Grace will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice, cooking oil and condiments, among others

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.es:
La Sra. Nicanora es de la ciudad de Concepción, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, ella tiene una despensa y carnicería donde atiende  todos los días de la semana, desde tempranas horas del día.
Es cliente recurrente de Fundación Paraguaya, con pagos excelentes en sus cuotas, pide este préstamo para la remodelación de su salón comercial, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, de manera a poder dar a su familia todo para una vida digna.
texts.en:
Nicanora is from the city of Concepción. She is a very hard-working and determined woman. She has a small grocery store and a butcher shop, where she works every day of the week starting in the early hours of the morning.

She is a recurrent client of Fundación Paraguaya, and she has made excellent payments on her previous loans. She is requesting a loan to remodel her commercial space. This way, she will be able to continue with her sales and, therefore, give her family everything for a dignified life.

loans.use: to expand her commercial space.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of 5 young children from Leyte, Philippines. Lilibeth has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than 5 years now. This is her main source of income. Lilibeth is requesting a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her in improving her business as well as her income. Lilibeth hopes to make her business more profitable and stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en: Adela is a rice farmer from Leyte, Philippines. She is 53 years old and married. She has been in the business for more than 20 years now. Adela runs a small sari-sari or retail store business. Adela is standing next to sacks of newly harvested rice. Adela is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments and cooking oil. This loan will help her improve her stocks thus attracting more buyers to her store.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments and cooking oil.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is a 26-year-old married woman and a mother of 3 young children from Leyte, Philippines. Elma has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than 2 years now. This is her main source of income. Elma is requesting a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her in improving her business as well as her income. Elma hopes to make her business more profitable and stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Agapito

texts.en: Agapito is a 53-year-old man from Leyte, Philippines. Agapito earns a living through his sari-sari or retail store business. He has operated his store for more than 30 years now. Agapito would like to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, condiments and cooking oil. This loan will enable Agapito in improving his stocks thus attracting more buyers to his store. In the future, Agapito dreams of making his business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, condiments and cooking oil

loans.name: Charivic

texts.en: Charivic is a tuba or coconut wine retailer from Leyte, Philippines. She is 44 years old and married. She has five children. Tuba or coconut wine is a common drink in the country. It can also be fermented into vinegar. Charivic also raises pigs for a supplemental income. Charivic is asking to take a loan to buy more tuba or coconut wine and piglets to raise. She believes that through this loan she will be able to improve her businesses as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more tuba or coconut wine and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 48 years old, married, and has six adult children. She is from Leyte, Philippines. She is engaged in a hog raising business, which she has been doing for more than 20 years.  

Violeta is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. This loan will help her improve her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing nets and crab traps

loans.name: Melva

texts.en: Her sari-sari store has been one of the sources of bread and butter for Melva’s family. Melva is 25 years old and has a four-year-old daughter. Her retail store has an earning of Php. 20,000 per month. She wants to take out a loan to buy additional stock for her store such as assorted goods, rice, and gasoline to sell retail. Expanding her grocery store is one of her goals for the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her store such as assorted goods, rice, and gasoline to sell retail

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
As a wife and mother, Rhea assists her family in every way possible. Her husband is a fisherman and their family has been in the business for eight years. Together, they have a consolidated income of Php. 11,600 per month. 

Rhea wants to take out a loan to buy a pumpboat and dried fish to be retailed. In the future, they plan to buy another pumpboat.

loans.use: to buy a pumpboat and dried fish

loans.name: Sherry Ann

texts.en:
Sherry Ann is 32 years old. She is married with three children aged three to ten. Sherry Ann and her husband rely on fishing to support  the needs of their children. She also makes and sells dried fish to augment their income. 

Sherry Ann is asking for a loan to buy another fishing boat and to produce more dried fish to sell. They work hard so they can continue sending their children to school and to have a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy another fishing boat and to produce more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Clarence

texts.en:
Clarence is 38 years old, married, and has two children. She is from San Dionisio in Iloilo.  Clarence is engaged in fishing and catching crabs, which she has been doing for 19 years. 

Clarence is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a new fishing boat, thus maximize her catch. In the future, she plans to buy more crab traps to catch more crabs and increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase a new fishing boat

loans.name: Jesery

texts.en:
Jesery is a 37-year-old married woman, from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She has one daughter, age four. Her husband is a fisherman in their town.  

Jesery has supported their fishing business, and helped to sell her husband's catch. She is asking for a loan to buy a new engine that is more efficient, to increase their catch. The loan will pave the way for her to have a better income. In the future, she hopes that her child can go to school, and live a better life.

loans.use: to buy a new engine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing nets and ropes.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is a resident of San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is 63 years old with a fifteen-year-old dependent. For the last ten years, Nimfa has been engaged in a Sari-sari (convenience) store business, buying and selling of dried fish and fishing to earn a living.

Nimfa is asking for a loan to buy stocks of goods such as detergent, bath soap, seasoning, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil and more fish to sell. Her income will be utilized for family daily consumption and to pay for tuition fees.

In the future, she plans to buy a new fishing boat to increase business profitability.

loans.use: to buy stocks of goods such as detergent, bath soap, seasoning, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ramila

texts.en:
Ramila is a 41 year old married woman. Her husband is a labourer and they have a daughter and two sons. Ramila is a farmer. She has a small area of land and a garden. She lives with her family in an IDP settlement in Bilesuvar region because they are refugees.

Ramila raises crops and vegetables. Her sons help her collect the harvest and sell it to local groceries and bazaars. Ramila has been a farmer for 18 years. She is experienced and earns 200 AZN monthly. Her income and the earnings of her husband don't cover the family's needs.

Ramila applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN in order to pay rent for a tractor. She needs to pay monthly fees for the tractor in order to be able to cultivate her land.

loans.use: to pay the monthly fees for a tractor in order to be able to cultivate her land.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tubers.

loans.name: Carmen Delia

texts.es:
Carmen, una mujer de 51 años de edad que ha dado toda su vida en beneficio de su familia intentando sacarla  adelante y superando juntos las adversidades que se les han presentado en la vida; gracias a una tienda que con mucho esfuerzo, paciencia y sacrificio logro montar, ha generado los ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos. 

Trabaja sola todos los días durante 9 horas.
Buscando ser la mejor empresa familiar del sector quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido que le permitan aumentar su inventario como granos y abarrotes.

De esta forma ira superando dificultades como las bajas ventas y la competencia.

Este crédito será la gran oportunidad para consolidarse como la tienda más productiva en el barrio y le dará la oportunidad de cumplir ese sueño que tanto ha anhelado de comprar una vivienda propia.

Apoya a Carmen con su negocio!
texts.en:
Carmen, 51, works with all her strength to ensure that her family can overcome whatever obstacles are thrown their way.  She owns a corner grocery, a business that she was only able to start with a lot of hard work, patience and sacrifice.  She works, alone, 9 hours a day and her earnings from the grocery support her children.  

Carmen wants her grocery to be the best grocery in the neighborhood and she is applying for a loan that she will use to stock it with the everyday products that her customers want.  The investment will help her to increase her sales and better compete with other similar businesses.

Your loans will help Carmen make her store the most productive in her neighborhood and fulfill her much hoped-for dream of owning a house of her own.

Please support Carmen's business.

loans.use: to stock her corner shop.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa est une femme mariée et âgée de 43 ans. Yawa vit à Attiégou avec ses deux enfants et exerce son activité pour subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de la famille. Coiffeuse, Yawa vend des mèches et des produits de beautés. Yawa s’approvisionne au marché deux fois par mois. Yawa demande ce prêt pour acheter des mèches et des tissages et satisfaire favorablement ses clients et avoir une bonne rentabilité afin d’aider ses enfants à s’épanouir
texts.en:
Yawa is a 43-year-old married woman. She lives in Attiégou with her two children and works to provide for her family’s daily needs.

As a hairdresser, Yawa sells extensions and cosmetics. She procures her supplies, twice a month, at the market. Yawa is requesting this loan to purchase extensions and weaves. She will thus be able to favorably satisfy her customers and make a good return, all to help her children come into their own.

loans.use: to buy one pack of extensions and one pack of weaves.

loans.name: Jorge Eliecer

texts.es:
Jorge, de 31 años, inicio con un negocio de alquiler de lavadoras hace aproximadamente 2 años con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.

En el momento, encuentra su motivación para trabajar incansablemente en su hija y es así como desea ofrecerle lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo.

Hoy en día su hija tiene 10 años y se han convertido en la alegría de este hombre trabajador.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de otra lavadora para mejorar la prestación de su servicio.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener su negocio y a su familia brindándoles una calidad de vida mejor.

Apoya a Jorge para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Jorge is 31 years old. With the eagerness to find a job that would provide him with an income in order to survive, he started a washing machine rental business approximately 2 years ago. At the moment, his daughter is his motivation to continue working tirelessly, as he hopes to provide the best for her life and development. Today, his daughter is 10 years old, and she has become this hard-working man's source of happiness.

He is requesting a loan to buy another washing machine in order to improve the delivery of his services. With this loan, he will be able to support his business as well as his family, giving them a better quality of life. Support Jorge so that he can continue with his business!

loans.use: to buy another washing machine in order to improve the delivery of his services.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 38 year old IDP. She is married and has a daughter and a son. Her husband is a labourer. He works hard in order to somehow provide for the family, but the main income for the family comes from farming. They have a small piece of land and raise crops there.

Aida has worked in the agricultural area for 15 years and earns 240 AZN monthly. She raises corn, wheat, etc. and some fruit trees too. Fresh fruit is in high demand. They also supply crops to local bazaars. Aida applied for a 1,500 ANZ loan in order to renew an old tractor.

loans.use: to repair her old tractor.

loans.name: Gunay

texts.en:
Gunay is a 25 year old refugee. She is single and lives with her parents in Bilesuvar IDP settlement.. Her parents are pensioners and Gunay earns money raising poultry in order to cover the family needs. She raises and fattens turkeys and then sells their meat to local cafes and bazaars. She has worked in this area for 5 years and has good skills. Her monthly income is only 150 AZN and it's not enough to meet life's demands.

Gunay keeps birds in a small wooden place built by herself. She applied for a 1,100 AZN loan in order to call the builders and build a good hennery for them. She wants to expand farming in future and build a big hennery.

loans.use: to call master builders and build a good hennery for her turkeys.

loans.name: Shahriyar

texts.en:
Shahriyar is 25 years old, married, and has two children. He is a farmer and refugee, living in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housekeeper. He raises crops and seasonal fruit trees, which he has been doing for three years. Shahriyar collects the harvest and supplies local and city bazaars and markets. His monthly income is 200 AZN, which does not cover his family's needs. 

Shahriyar requested a loan for 800 AZN, which he will use to buy new seeds for crops, thus increasing the productivity of his land. He wants to expand his business and raise more crops and trees.

loans.use: to purchase new seeds for crops

loans.name: Herminda

texts.en:
Herminda is from the town of San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is 59 years old and operates a sari-sari (convenience) store in her community, which she has done for five years. She sells basic household basic commodities like detergent, seasoning, toiletries, chips, canned goods and soft drinks. In addition to this, she also helps in their fishing business which is mostly managed by her husband.

Herminda is asking for a loan to buy more items to resell, like coffee, sugar, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, insect repellent, rice and gasoline. These items are in high demand and sell well on a daily basis. With a loan, Herminda is confident that her sari-sari business will be more prosperous.

She will use her profits for the school fees of her youngest child who is 16 years old.

loans.use: to buy more items to resell, like coffee, sugar, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, insect repellent, rice and gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase spices

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Tessie earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, sugar, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Tessie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from providing motorcycle transportation services. Jocelyn is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to  purchase additional inventory like soft drinks, sugar, biscuits, etc. to sell in her general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase inventory like soft drinks, sugar, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is married and has five children. She works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling clothes.  

Lilibeth is requesting her seventh loan from NWTF for 16,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fishing materials such as rope and fishing net. With this loan, she hopes to further build her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as rope and fishing net

loans.name: Nidia Modesta

texts.es:
Nidia ha sido una ama de casa muy dedicada, siempre pendiente del cuidado de su familia conformada por su hijo y su esposo; desde siempre le ha gustado trabajar como comerciante independiente, comenzó a vender mercancía desde hace 5 años, pues es responsable de llevar la carga económica del hogar junto con su esposo y necesita generar los recursos para hacerlo. 
Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos del sector, trabaja sola todos los días en su negocio y encuentra en su labor la ventaja de poder estar pendiente de su familia, al mismo tiempo que logra ser productiva como comerciante.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor de artículos de uso personal como cremas y lociones, pues es una gran oportunidad en esta época del año, esto le permitirá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para su familia.

Nidia manifiesta que su mayor deseo es poder seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia y dar educación su hijo, para verlo¿ convertirse en profesional y tenga un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Nidia was and is a dedicated wife and mother, committed to caring for her husband and son.  She long wanted a business of her own, though, and started her own personal products sales business 5 years ago.  The business, she says, is her means of sharing responsibility with her husband for paying the family's bills.  Nidia sells her merchandise to friends, family and other buyers in her neighborhood.  She works most days and says that the business is both a means of helping her family and something that is hers alone.

Nidia is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with wholesale supplies of the merchandise she sells: creams, lotions, etc.  She says that this is a particularly good time of year for businesses like hers and she needs a good supply of products that her customers most want.  The investment will help her to meet demand and increase her family's income.

Nidia says that her greatest wish is to go on providing for her family and helping her children get good educations.  She wants to ensure that they are prepared for paid careers and can have a prosperous and successful future.

loans.use: to stock her personal products sales business.

loans.name: Duguyiriwaton Group

texts.fr:
Bakary est le monsieur qui tient le mouton par la corne sur la photo.	
Bakary est un malien âgée de 45 ans, il est père de 8 enfants dont 3 fréquentent  l’école coraniques et  5 vont à l’école. Bakary n’a pas été à l’école, sa femme fait le  commerce de poisson.  Bakary exerce comme activité d’élevage ovines  il y a plus de 10 (dix)  ans, il achète les moutons, les élevés et les revend  dans les foires environnantes.  Il peut   gagner 40000 FCFA  comme bénéfice  sur les ventes. Il  fait recourt au RMCR  pour améliorer son activité afin d’avoir beaucoup de revenus. L’élevage de Bakary lui permettra de prendre en charge les frais médicaux de ses enfants et améliorer leurs conditions de vie. Bakary aime son activité et dans les jours à venir il compte acheter plus d’animaux.
texts.en:
Bakary is the man holding the sheep by his horn on the photo. He is a 45-year-old Malian. He is a father of eight; three of the children go to Koranic school, and five attend school. Bakary did not go to school. His wife sells fish.

Bakary’s profession is sheep husbandry. For over ten years, he has been buying sheep, raising them, and reselling them at local fairs. He can earn 40,000 XOF as profit on his sales.

He is turning to RMCR to improve his business and have great revenues. Bakari’s business will allow him to pay for his children’s medical expenses and to improve their living conditions. Bakari loves his job and, in the coming days, he plans on purchasing more animals.

loans.use: to buy sheep to raise and resell.

loans.name: Isidro Antonio

texts.es: Isidro de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cinco hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 30 años, con las ventas que realiza de sus productos logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando, puertas, ventanas y techo, pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón, solicita un crédito para la compra de  puertas, balcones, laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra y asi el y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros y cómodos.
texts.en:
Isidro is 44 years old and lives in his own home along with his five children. He has been farming for 30 years. With the sale of his products, Isidro is able to cover some of his household expenses.

He wants to improve his home by replacing the doors, windows, and roof. However, he does not earn enough from his sales to cover this project. Therefore, Isidro is requesting a loan in order to buy doors, railings, roofing sheets, and beams, as well as pay for labor. As a result, he and his family can live more securely and comfortably.

loans.use: to pay for doors, railings, roofing sheets, beams, and labor.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years. Renalyn earns additional income from manicure and pedicure services and a general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like fruit, sugar, milk, etc for her food vending business.

Renalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like fruit, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 26 years old and married with three children, two of whom in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Jennifer has been pig fattening for 2 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice and a general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Jennifer is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed and materials like wood, nipa roofing etc for her pig-pens.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed and materials like wood, nipa roofing etc for her pig-pens.

loans.name: Norelyn

texts.en:
Norelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years. Norelyn earns additional income from pig fattening.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell for her general store business.

Norelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Gladys Ondina

texts.es: Gladys, tiene 45 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos, reside en una aldea del municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Ella siempre se ha dedicado a su propio negocio, inicio con una pulpería y ahora cuenta con su propio cultivo de yuca. Esta producción es de buena calidad y la vende a intermediarios de la zona. Ha obtenido varios préstamos en la institucion, con el actual es el sexto ciclo y es por 17,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar abonos y pago por limpieza para asegurar buenas cosechas de yuca. Su propósito es que tenga buena asistencia para que sea rentable y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Gladys is 45 years old, married, and has two children. She resides in a neighborhood in the town of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.

Gladys has always managed a business of her own. She started out with a grocery store, but now she has her own cassava crops. The crops she produces are of good quality and she sells them to brokers in the area. Gladys has received several loans from ODEF and now she is requesting her sixth one in the amount of 17,000 HNL. She will use the money to buy compost and pay to have weeds removed so that she can guarantee a good cassava harvest.

Her goal is to keep her crops well-maintained for a profitable harvest so that she can help her family.

loans.use: to buy compost and pay to have weeds removed from her cassava crop.

loans.name: Ejido De Mayorazgo Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Ejido de Mayorazgo" está conformado por habitantes de una comunidad con raíces indígenas de la cultura mazahua. EL lugar ya se ha desarrollado con el paso del tiempo y cuentan con servicios como escuelas, centros de salud, luz, drenaje, agua potable. Sin embargo, la comunidad conserva su tranquilidad y la amabilidad de las personas. 

El grupo de préstamo está integrado por personas trabajadoras y decididas a forjar un mejor futuro para los suyos: Ma Elidia quien se dedica a criar y vender borregos; Josefina, a la venta de abarrotes; Carolina, a preparar y vender jugos y ensaladas de frutas; Federico, a criar y vender vacas y borregos y finalmente, Juan, a vender alimento para becerros.

Don Federico formó una familia con doña Alejandra hace 23 años, procrearon 5 hijos de los cuales ya sólo dos dependen económicamente de ellos; uno estudia la primaria y el otro la secundaria. Don Federico habla algunas palabras mazahuas y está orgulloso por ello aunque no puede entablar una comunicación al 100% en este idioma, el de sus antepasados.

Don Federico recibió su primer préstamo hace ya 9 años, desde entonces inició con la compra y venta de ganado el cual conserva y cuida durante 4 meses para después venderlo. La alimentación de sus animales es fundamental ya que determina el peso de los mismos y puede obtener más beneficios al momento de venderlos por kilo. El frío ha hecho algunas malas jugadas al negocio de Federico, le ha quitado ya algunas cabezas de ganado lo que para significa pérdidas para él. Sin embargo, su dedicación le ha impulsado a continuar con la actividad y siempre trata de mejorar el lugar donde conserva a los animales, espacio con el que no contaba al principio. En esta temporada, la comunidad donde vive Federico, enfrenta la sequía, los prados han perdido su color y por ello necesita comprar pastura con su crédito.

Además, Federico también renta mesas y sillas para brindar aun mejores oportunidades a su familia. Este segundo negocio fue posible gracias a sus ahorros, ganancias de la venta de ganado y a los demás préstamos es por eso que agradece por cada uno que se le ha otorgado.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el kiosco del municipio donde viven los integrantes, el cual ofrece una vista agradable. Don Federico está sentado en segundo escalón, viste camisa de manga larga color azul y una gorra naranja. Por las mañanas, en el lugar se observan varios vendedores de café y atole calientes para que las personas logren atenuar un poco el eterno frío de la región.
texts.en:
The members of the Ejido de Mayorazgo community bank are drawn from the indigenous Mazahua people of this region.  The area is developed and well-serviced with schools, health centers, and electric and clean water services.  Even so, the people here maintain a serene and friendly way of life. 

The group's members work hard and are committed to building better futures for themselves: Ma Elidia raises and sells sheep; Josefina has a corner grocery; Carolina makes and sells juices and salads; Federico raises and sells cattle and sheep; and Juan sells livestock feed.

Don Federico and his wife, doña Alejandra have been married for 23 years and have 5 children, three of whom are independent now.  One child is still in elementary school and another is in high school.  Don Federico speaks a bit of the Mazahua language and says that even though he isn't 100% fluent he is proud to know something of the language of his ancestors.

Don Federico received his first loan 9 years ago.  Since then, he has started his own business buying and selling cattle.  He keeps the cattle for 4 months, fattens them and sells them on to his customers.  His success depends on how much weight the cows add before he sells them so the care and feeding of the animals is critical to his business.  The cold has been hard on Federico's business and killed some of the cattle, a significant loss for him.  He has persevered, nonetheless, and tried to improve the space where he keeps the cattle.  He now needs hay for the cattle because the area here faces drought and much of the grass has died.

Federico has a second business renting tables and chairs.  He started that business with savings earned from his livestock business and says that his earnings from both businesses provide his family with more opportunity than they would otherwise have.

*The photo was taken at a kiosk in the town where the group's members live.  Don Federico is sitting on the second step in the photo, wearing a long-sleeved blue shirt and orange baseball cap.  During mornings here, you will see stands selling coffee and other hot drinks, welcome relief to the frigid cold of this region.

loans.use: Comprara pastura.

loans.name: Anitakotanta Tsiri Yotaneripee Group

texts.es: Ricardina de 38 años soltera, con dos  hijos quienes aún asisten al colegio. Ricardina es docente bilingüe contratada  ella trabaja en un centro educativo. Muy aparte de su trabajo también se dedica a la siembra de café y cacao  hace 10 años. El sueño de Ricardina es brindarles apoyo a sus hijos en sus estudios superiores. Requiere el crédito para comprar abono  fertilizante y así poder mejorar su cultivo de café y cacao para tener una mayor producción. Ella viste polo color blanco,se siente muy contenta de haber recibido el apoyo de los inversionistas Kiva.
texts.en:
Ricardina, 38, is single and has two children who still attend school. Ricardina is employed at a school as a bilingual teacher. 

Aside from her work, she has also been growing coffee beans and cocoa beans for the past ten years. Ricardina's dream is to support her children through higher education. She needs the loan to buy manure and fertilizer to be able to improve her coffee bean and cocoa bean crop, to have a better yield. 

She is wearing the white t-shirt. She is happy to have received the support from Kiva investors.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Luz Amparo es una mujer  que está tratando de impulsar su negocio de venta de mercancía y accesorios de decoración.
Inicio este negocio por dos motivos uno de ellos por gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente y el otro de ellos por neta necesidad económica, ella viene de una familia muy humilde y con esfuerzo trata de ganarse el sustento para su familia, pero cansada de solo sobrevivir busco ayuda para que su negocio de un giro radical.
Luz Amparo se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el motivo es que quiere introducir nueva mercancía en su negocio, decoraciones en icopor, artículos de fiesta, de papelería y accesorios.
Con este nuevo cambio espera atraer más clientes, mejorar sus ventas y darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Amparo is a woman who is trying to boost her business of selling merchandise and decorations. She started this business for two reasons. First of all, she enjoys working and wanted to do something in which she could be independent. Secondly, she works out of financial necessity. Luz Amparo comes from a very modest family, so she does her best to support them. Whenever she is tired, she only thinks about survival by seeking out assistance with radically transforming her business.

Luz Amparo is requesting a loan because she wants to introduce new merchandise into her business such as styrofoam decorations, party supplies, paper goods, and accessories. With this new change, she hopes to attract more customers, improve her sales, and provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy styrofoam decorations, party supplies, paper goods, and accessories.

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.en: Zacarias is 72 years old, he is a single man with many wishes of improving his life. He is dedicated to raising farm animals in his home, such as sheep, pigs and guinea pigs. He sells the animals on a monthly basis and buys new, high-quality ones to raise. Zacarias's loan will allow him to buy piglets as well as organic food and vitamins for his animals.  Zacarias also uses the animal excrement to fertilize his crop of alfalfa, and ecologically friendly practice. Moreover animals will be fed with organic products which are cultivated in the same local area.  In the future he wishes to have economic security for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy new piglets and organic feed

loans.name: Aliandrina

texts.en: Aliandrina is 25, a single mother and currently the main source of family income. She is dedicated to agriculture and requires credit for the purchase of high-quality guinea pigs, which will be fed with ecologically friendly products such as alfalfa. Also part of the credit will go to buy extra guinea pigs so that they can reproduce and at the end she will sell their excrement for ecological fertilizers. In her future plans she would like to give a better life to her family and provide the best education because currently she experiences poor conditions of life.

loans.use: to buy and sustainably raise guinea pigs

loans.name: Elar

texts.en: Elar is a 54 years old man, married and breadwinner. He is engaged in agriculture and his main activity is about corn crop. He uses ecologically friendly seeds. He currently requires credit for the extension of agricultural land, in which he will use certified kiwicha seeds. His future plans are to ensure a good harvest, increase the quality of his products as well as giving a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for the cultivation of kiwicha.

loans.name: Rony Ivan

texts.es:
Rony, de 19 años de edad, es un joven emprendedor luchador y muy entregado a su familia, está soltero y no tiene hijos.

Rony, desde hace 4 años tiene un puesto de reparación y venta de celulares, el cual está administrando, este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar celulares y vitrinas para exhibir sus productos.
 
Rony, sueña con expandir su negocio a otras comunidades y ser un gran empresario.
texts.en:
Rony is 19 years old. This determined young entrepreneur is extremely devoted to his family. He is single and has no children.

For the past four years, Rony has operated a shop where he repairs and sells mobile phones. He manages this business as his main source of income. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy mobile phones and display cabinets for exhibiting his products.

Rony dreams of expanding his business to other communities and becoming a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and display cabinets for exhibiting his products.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 34 years old. She is married and has four children.  She is dedicated to the cultivation of corn and she uses environmentally friendly processes such as organic fertilizers. She requires credit in order to buy farmland. Her future plans are to give the best quality of life to her four children in addition to ensuring that each of them can realize their dreams.

loans.use: To buy a field to cultivate green crops

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. Elena has been in this business for 5 years. Elena earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her business for her fishing business.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her businesses to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ruth works hard to support her family. She has a farming rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Ruth is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farming business.

Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Angelina works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell plasticware business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Angelina is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of plasticware to sell for her business.

Angelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of plasticware for her business.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Aileen works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Aileen is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, egg, canned goods, etc for her general store business.

Aileen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, egg, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a farming rice business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years. Jocelyn earns additional income from pig fattening.

Jocelyn successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional farm supplies for her farming rice business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional farm supplies

loans.name: Libardo Alonso

texts.es:
Libardo es un hombre con gran empuje y emprendimiento, desde hace un tiempo se determino a encontrar una actividad que le generar buenos ingresos y que le permitiera ser independiente, es así como desde hace 1 año inicio con un negocio de billares y juegos de azar en el municipio de Yarumal.
Es un negocio bastante popular en el sector y se ha convertido en punto de encuentro para adultos.
Con tan poco tiempo en el mercado ya tiene cierto nivel de reconocimiento gracias a la buena gestión de Libardo.
El solicita un préstamo para realizar una mejora locativa en la parte donde tiene ubicadas las mesas de billar ya que quiere hacerla mucho más atractiva y cómoda para sus clientes, además desea comprar surtido de bebidas, licores y frituras para aumentar sus ventas.
El desea generar empleos.
texts.en:
Libardo is a hard-working and enterprising man.  He long wanted to find a business that would allow him to both work for himself and generate a good income.  He found a perfect fit last year, opening a pub, billiards and games business in Yarumal.  The business has proven popular and has become something of a meeting place for locals.  
Libado has shown himself to be a good manager and the pub has become a success in a very short time.  He is applying for a loan now, part of which he will use to improve the space where he keeps billiard tables.  He wants to make the space more attractive and more comfortable for his customers.  He will use the rest of the loan to stock his business with beer, liquor and snacks for resale.  
For the future, Libado hopes to hire employees for the business.

loans.use: to make improvements to and buy supplies for his pub business.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Avancemos Group

texts.es: Doña Lilliana es una señora de 32 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijos. Dos están cursando la secundaria. Humilde y trabajadora. La comunidad en la que vive es rural y la fuente de empleo mayor es la agricultura. Ella es integrante del banco mujer Avancemos y escogen el nombre debido a que ya cuentan con las actividades productivas y desean avanzar creciendo en ellas. Se enteró de los servicios de Fundación Mujer por medio de otra socia de un banco y de ahí sintió la necesidad de solicitar financiamiento para reforzar su negocio, el cual es el comercio ambulante de zapatos, con la finalidad de generar ingresos y ayudar en su hogar, ésto debido a que su esposo es jornalero y lo que percibe es muy poco. Su meta es crecer y superarse para mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia. Junto con Lilliana hay cinco socias mas que invertirán su préstamo en agricultura y avicultura. Todas buscando un mismo objetivo crecimiento y superación.
texts.en:
Doña Lilliana is a 32-year-old woman who is married and the mother of three children. Two of her children are in secondary school. Liliana is a humble and hardworking woman. The community where she lives is rural and the main source of employment is agriculture. She is a member of the Women’s Communal Bank named “Avancemos” (We Move Forward). The members chose this name because they all have productive business activities and want to keep them growing.

Liliana learned about the services offered by Fundación Mujer from another Communal Bank member and felt that she needed to apply for a loan in order to strengthen her business. She is a traveling shoe merchant who generates income to help her household. Her husband is a day laborer who earns very little pay. Liliana’s goal is to grow and overcome obstacles so that she can improve her living conditions and those of her family.

In addition to Liliana, there are five other members who will invest their loans in agriculture and raising poultry. All of them have the same goal of growing and overcoming challenges.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a welding shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy iron bars, plain sheets, and other materials for her welding shop business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy iron bars, plain sheets, and other materials for her welding business.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc. for her general store business.

Margie has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from buying and selling food supplements.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Margie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married and has seven children. She works hard to support her family. She operates a general store business in the Philippines She earns additional income from raising pigs and selling wood.  

Teresita is requesting her twentieth loan from NWTF for 22,000 PHP, which she will use to  buy items such as shampoo  and groceries to sell in her general store business. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Maira

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Maira works hard to support her family.

She has a palm tree farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and buying and selling vegetables.  Maira is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her farming palm trees business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Maira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her business

loans.name: Jelen

texts.en:
Jelen works hard to support her family. Jelen is married and has a business buying and selling ready to wear in the Philippines.

Jelen requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of ready to wear to sell.

Jelen has been in this business for 8 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Jelen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of ready to wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Logitu

texts.en: Logitu is a 60-year-old mother with 4 children. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. Logitu has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, and a printing machine to assist her with runing the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. Logitu hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, and a printing machine.

loans.name: Aifaalua

texts.en:
Aifaalua is a 60-year-old mother with 7 children. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. Aifaalua has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei design, containers, and a printing machine to assist her with running the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Aifaalua  hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei design, containers, and a printing machine

loans.name: Suiti

texts.en:
Suiti is a 49-year-old mother, with four children. To earn a living, she runs a small business, selling ice cakes in her community. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Suiti has requested a loan to buy a sack of sugar, plastic bags, ice bags, containers, and a cooler machine to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business in her community. 

Suiti became a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2006.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, plastic bags, ice bags, containers, and a cooler machine.

loans.name: Judith Karen

texts.es: Judith tiene 20 años de edad y es soltera, actualmente se encuentra estudiando Administración Industrial en el instituto SENATI en donde  ya va por el III ciclo de la carrera y debido a los trabajos que tiene en el estudio necesita una computadora y herramientas que le faciliten sus trabajos del instituto y es por esto que está solicitando el préstamo para poder seguir adelante con sus objetivos y metas planteadas. Judith nos cuenta que una vez que termine la carrera trabajara en una empresa muy importante y con la experiencia ganada formara su propia empresa textil que será administrada por ella misma. También nos hace saber que se siente muy agradecida y feliz por el apoyo y la confianza que depositan en ella.
texts.en:
Judith is 20 years old and single. She is currently studying Industrial Management at the SENATI Institute, where she is in the third module of her degree program. In order to complete the work for her studies, Judith needs a computer and equipment to help facilitate her assignments at the institute. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can continue forward with her established goals and objectives.

Judith says that once she finishes her degree, she will work for a very important company. With the experience she gained from starting her own textile business, she will be able to utilize the same set of management skills. She also says that she is very grateful and pleased with the support and trust that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy a computer and equipment for her studies.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy an ice box and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Deborah has been in this business for 18 years. She earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Deborah has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy an ice box and other fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Juanita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and raising pigs. Juanita is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell in her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos, a sus 59 años de edad, es un hombre carismático y servicial que se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una tienda escolar que inició por la necesidad de generar ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. 
A pesar de las adversidades, el tuvo la fortaleza y la determinación para levantarse y seguir adelante y, gracias a ello lleva uno meses  de trayectoria en esta actividad.
Trabaja 5 días durante 12 horas con 1 sobrina que le ayuda por gusto en sus ratos libres (Ver Foto)
Su propósito en la vida es seguir progresando y por ello desea fortalecer su negocio acreditándolo con la compra de surtido de productos como frituras, bebidas gaseosas y en general productos básicos de consumo infantil, de esta forma podrá ofrecer a sus clientes y estudiantes una mejor calidad y servicio, logrando aumentar notablemente sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe de sus ventas.
Carlos manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo su negocio con la ayuda de Interactuar y en un futuro desea convertirlo en una gran cadena de tiendas, en el que los clientes puedan encontrar todos los artículos que necesiten. 

Apoyando a este crédito estarás contribuyendo con el emprendimiento de los hombres Colombianos!
texts.en: Carlos is 59 years old. He is a charismatic and generous man who works in his own business, a school shop which he started due to the need to generate income and get his family ahead.  In spite of the adversities, he had the strength and determination to continue and press on. Thanks to this, he has several months in this activity. He works five days a week, 12 hour days with a niece who helps him in her spare time (see picture.) His goal in life is to continue advancing.  He wants to strengthen the business by buying diverse products such as fried snacks, soda pop, and, in general, basic products for children's consumption. This way, he will be able to offer his clients and students better quality and service, increasing his sales and earnings obtained from these sales. Carlos stated that his biggest desire is to continue growing his business with the help of Interactuar, so that in the future he could convert the business into a chain of stores where his clients can find all the items they need. By supporting this loan you will be contributing to the entrepreneurship of Colombian men!

loans.use: To purchase diverse products such as fried snacks, soda pop and, in general,  basic products for children's consumption.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plant formulas, insecticides, and foliar fertilizers to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is a 49-year-old mother with nine children. She runs a small business of cooking rice and curry and selling it in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Tina has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, box of curry, box of chicken, sack of rice, bottle of vegetable oil, a gas stove, sack of potatoes, sack of onions, plastic bags, and a container, to help her run the business.

Tina will use her profit to build a small restaurant in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, box of curry, box of chicken, sack of rice, bottle of vegetable oil, a gas stove, sack of potatoes, sack of onions, plastic bags, and a container.

loans.name: Uilaao

texts.en:
Uilaao is a 36-year-old mother with one child. She runs a small business of selling tuna sandwiches and toasted sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Uilaao has requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, a container, butter, and mayonnaise to assist with the business.

She will expand her business using her profit. Uilaao became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, a container, butter, and mayonnaise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Isamara

texts.es:
La Sra. Isamara está casada, tiene un hijo por quien está luchando para poder darle todo para una vida digna, ella es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropas semis y usadas. Su puesto de venta tiene en un lugar estratégico donde hace sus ventas.
Es una señora muy emprendedora, aparte de trabajar y ser mamá también va a la facultad. Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas varias, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Señora Isamara is married and has one child for whom she fights so as to be able to give him everything for a dignified life. She is a merchant and makes her living selling semi-new and used clothing. Her sales stall is located in a strategic place where she makes her sales.

She is a very entrepreneurial woman. In addition to working and being a mother, she goes to university. She is requesting this loan to purchase various apparel and that way she will be able to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy various apparel for resale.

loans.name: Dúo Fátima De Sumpango Group

texts.es:
Dúo fatima de sumpango
Este dúo está conformado por Sandra es originaria de sumpango y es soltera, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas todos los días desde muy temprano empieza a trabajar para poder cocer el maíz que utilizara para poder prepararla y luego venderla, es el tercer crédito que solicita con kiva, gracias a la ayuda que ha tenido le ha ido muy bien y ha comprado otro comal mas, el crédito que están solicitando es para poder comprar más maíz ya que en esta temporada el maíz baja de precio y es más económico comprarlo.
texts.en: The duo Fatima de Sumpango is composed of two women. One of these women is Sandra who is originally from Sumpango and is currently single and who makes fresh tortillas every day beginning early in the morning. She has to start early in order to cook the corn so she can then make it into tortillas and then sell them. This is the third loan she is applying for with Kiva. Thanks to the help she has received, she was ale to purchase another comal (used to grind corn). With the current loan, she will purchase more corn because corn prices are currently low and it is more economic to buy now.

loans.use: purchase corn.

loans.name: Maria Christina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Maria Christina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell curtains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Maria Christina is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy additional curtains to sell for her curtains business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Maria Christina has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional curtains to sell for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food supplies in bulk

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Blanca es una microempresaria dedicada y trabajadora, su campo de acción es la confección, prestando el servicio a terceros.

Todo comenzó hace unos años cuando trabajaba como operaria en un taller de confección; hoy en día, a sus 32 años de edad, ya tiene su propio taller en el que genera 1 empleo directo; trabaja todos los días y su fortaleza es la fabricación de pantalones y camisas de uniformes; de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de una máquina plana, así podrá cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes y entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna, con el fin aumentar la producción y adquirir nuevos contratos, que permitan darle continuidad a su microempresa.

Blanca sueña con seguir fortaleciendo su taller y tener cada día mayor nivel de producción para generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de su familia como la de las personas que influyen diariamente en su labor.
texts.en:
Blanca is a dedicated and hard-working micro-entrepreneur who works in the dressmaking field offering services to third parties. Everything started a few years ago when she worked in a dressmaking workshop. Today, at 32 years old, she has her own workshop and generates one direct job. She works everyday and her biggest strength is making pants and uniform shirts. Thanks to her workshop she obtains enough financial resources to contribute to their household expenses with her husband. 

She is requesting a loan to buy a flat sewing machine, so that she will be able to meet her clients' requirements and deliver orders on time. Her goal is to increase production and to sign new contracts that will give stability to her micro-company. 

Blanca's dream is to keep improving her workshop and increasing production. She wants to generate more employment opportunities and improve the quality of life of her family and the people who directly interacts with her work.

loans.use: to buy a flat sewing machine.

loans.name: Rolsalba

texts.es:
Rosalba es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de La Dorada desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación de comidas por encargo como lo son los tamales, chorizos, empanadas, arepas, entre otros.
Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Rosalba y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.
Rosalba desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de algunos utensilios de cocina y compra de insumos para continuar realizando sus recetas como pollos, harina, queso, entre otros.
Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia, oportunidad que le brinda la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Rosalba is a humble and hardworking woman who has devoted a large part of her life to caring for her children. She lives in the city of La Dorada, where she also works, cooking for her business where she prepares catered meals such as tamales, sausages, empanadas, areas, and more.  She sells these primarily to her neighbors who know Rosalba's flavor and know that they will always be able to get delicious and well prepared meals from her.

Rosalba hopes to increase her sales and wants to work in a more comfortable setting.  For these reasons, she is seeking a loan to purchase kitchen utensils and ingredients such as, chickens, flour, cheese, etc., so that she can continue cooking her meals.  This loan from Corporación Interactuar will allow her to keep her business going so that she can generate the necessary income to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: purchase cooking utensils and ingredients such as, chickens, flour, cheese, etc., so that she can continue cooking her meals.

loans.name: Hernan Dario

texts.es:
El señor Hernan es un hombre emprendedor y aplicado, desde hace 17 años comenzó con una legumbreria que hasta ahora le ha dado muy buenos resultados. El vive en el municipio de La Ceja con su familia a la cual manifiesta que tiene mucho que agradecerle en la vida.
El trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8:00 Am hasta las 5:00 Pm atendiendo un número de cliente medianamente alto.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar productos a granel como frutas, verduras y granos, entre otros y de éste modo satisfacer los deseos de los clientes que le piden estos productos.
Esta ayuda le permitirá inyectar variedad a su negocio y le brindara la jugosa oportunidad de mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Hernan is an enterprising and dedicated man.  17 years ago started a vegetable store that to this day has been very successful.  He lives in the city of La Ceja with his family, for whom he is very thankful.  He works Monday through Saturday from 8am to 5pm serving a large amount of customers.  

He is seeking a loan to purchase products such as fruit, vegetables and grains in bulk.  This way he will be able to satisfy the demand of his customers.  This help will allow him to add more variety to his business and will provide a great opportunity to improve her sales and his earnings.

loans.use: purchase products such as fruit, vegetables and grains, in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, de 38 años de edad, actualmente está casada y su esposo se dedica  a la agricultura, de esa manera apoya con la alimentación del hogar, tiene 3 hijos pequeños que aún viven con ellos.

María, tiene más de 12 años trabajando en un cafetín ubicado en la escuela de su comunidad, los niños de la escuela la conocen muy bien, pues ella es la persona que lleva los alimentos que ellos disfrutaran en los recreos.

María, utilizara el dinero para comprar productos como: golosinas, gaseosas, jugos, pan, galletas, dulces, entre otros, para su negocio y con el resto del dinero le hará una pequeña ampliación a su cafetín, ya que está muy pequeño.

En un futuro María, desea construir una nueva vivienda, para que su familia viva mejor y su calidad de vida mejore notablemente.
texts.en:
María is 38 years old and married.  Her husband makes a living in agriculture, thus helping with food for the home.  She has three small children who still live with them.

María has spent more than 13 years working in a snack bar located at a school in her community.  The school's children know her very well since she is the person who has the food that they enjoy during recess.

María will use the money to buy products like candy, sodas, juices, bread, sweets, and other items for her business; and with the rest of the money she will make a small extension to her snack bar since it is very small.

In the future, María hopes to build a new home so that her family can live better and their quality of life improves considerably.

loans.use: to buy products like candy, sodas, juices, bread, cookies, sweets, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Jenny Maricela

texts.es: Jenny, tiene 31 años de edad está estudiando en la universidad pedagógica a distancia la carrera de licenciatura en ciencias sociales los fines de semana en donde ya lleva cuatro años de estudio. Ella es madre soltera, la cual tiene un hijo de 13 años, quien está en segundo de ciclo, ella vive con sus padres y dos hermanas.
