Ella se dedica al cultivo del café desde que era niña siendo sus padres agricultores; pero al cumplir la edad adulta se independizo ya que su padre le dio una manzana de tierra en donde ella la cultivo y sigue cultivándola ubicada a 15 minutos caminando o a veces se va en vehículo con su padre. Como fuente extra de ingresos ella también es maestra del kínder en su comunidad en donde ya tiene varios años de laborar. Su padre le apoya en el mantenimiento y en ocasiones paga mano de obra para asistir sus cultivos mientras ella está en el centro educativo involucrándose al 100% en la temporada de corte y por las tardes. Ella solicita crédito para poder asistir y cuidar sus cultivos de café comprando abono, foliares, fertilizantes entre otros ya que es necesario porque está floreciendo la planta y la propiedad esta montosa. Ella quiere seguir ampliando su propiedad, fortalecer el patrimonio para su hijo y ofrecerle una mejor vida y mayores oportunidades ya que el negocio de café es rentable cuando la propiedad y dedicación es la correcta por lo cual espera se le apoye con este crédito para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jenny is 31 years old. She is pursuing a degree in Social Sciences at the Universidad Pedagógica via online learning. She has been taking the courses on weekends for four years now. 

Jenny is a single mother of a 13-year-old boy, who is attending high school. They live with her parents and her two sisters. 

Her parents are farmers, and she has been growing coffee since she was a child. When she reached the legal age, she became independent for her father gave her a plot of land (about 1.75 acres), which she has been farming ever since. Her field is 15 minutes away on foot, but sometimes she and her father take a vehicle to get there.

She also earns an additional income by working as a kindergarten teacher in her community, where she has been working for many years now.
 
Her father helps her out with the land maintenance and sometimes pays for labor to help her with the crops while she is at the school, getting involved 100% during the harvest season and in the evenings.

She is requesting a loan to maintain and care for her coffee crops since the plants are blooming and the land is uneven. 

She wants to keep on expanding her property, build up the family estate for her son, and give him a better life and better opportunities. The coffee business is profitable when the land is fertile and the required amount of effort is put in.

For these reasons, she hopes to be granted this loan so that she can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and to pay for labor to help with her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase milk to make cheese to sell

loans.name: Dario

texts.es:
El Sr. Darío de 31 años de edad, está en pareja, y comenta que tiene un hijo, vive en la ciudad de Itá.
 Don Darío se dedica a prestar servicios de albañilería, anteriormente trabajaba para otra persona y con el transcurrir de los años y la experiencia que fue ganando se independizo para así poder aumentar más sus ingresos y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
El pide este préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción y herramientas varias.
texts.en:
Dario is 31 years old. He has a partner and a child. He lives in the city of Itá.
Dario earns a living lending his construction services. He used to work with another person and over the years and with the experience that he gained he started to work on his own in order to increase his income further and give his family a better quality of life.
He is asking for this loan to buy construction materials and various tools.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and tools.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El Sr. Oscar de 37 años, está acompañado con la Sra. Nancy con quien tiene una familia con dos hijos, son una pareja muy trabajadora y por sobre todo luchadora.
El es comerciante, tiene una despensa muy bien surtida en su casa, para una buena administración del negocio su familia le ayuda. Tiene una clientela bien formada gracias a los diversos y variados productos que ofrece.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, carne, panificados, lácteos y otros, de manera a poder seguir creciendo cada día.
texts.en:
Oscar is 37 years old. He is married to Nancy with whom he has a family with two children. They are a hardworking couple and are above all determined.
He is a businessman, he has a well stocked general store in his house. His family help him to manage the business well. He has a well formed clientele thanks to the diverse and varied products that he offers.
He is asking for this loan to be able to invest in supplies for his store such as vegetables, meat, baked good, dairy products and other products, so that he can continue to grow day by day.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, baked goods, dairy products and others products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina had a small piggery business until she became a boss with her own meat shop. 

She has managed to have enough meat supplies for her shop and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Every day she makes good sales because of her good selling skills. 

Recently she approached Paglaum for much-needed capital to pay for five pigs and bags of feeds. 

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to pay for five pigs and bags of feeds.

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en:
Ailene is engaged in running a grocery store. She has been operating her business for five years and earns a monthly net income of 3,200 PHP. 
She is 37 years old, married and has two school-aged kids. She is from the village of Datu Tangkilan, Sindangan. 

In 2011, Ailene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ailene has successfully repaid her previous loans without records of default up to this day. 

Ailene is requesting her 12th loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy additional store inventory to retail.

loans.use: to buy additional store inventory to retail

loans.name: Nerrie

texts.en:
Nerrie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, noodles, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Nerrie has been in this business for eight years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, noodles, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Firuzjon

texts.ru: Фирузчон молодой и трудолюбивый парень 28 лет. Он родился в  городе Истаравшане в семьи рабочего. Фирузчон женат и имеет двоих  детей. У него очень дружная семья. Они стараются  воспитать своих детей хорошими людьми. Фирузчон вместе с семьёй живет в доме который сам построил. Фирузчон  таксист. Он уже 2 года занимается извозом и знает все тонкости этого дела. Фирузчон хочет отремонтировать свой автомобиль, но для этого нужны денежные средства. Вот по этому он пришел в Арванд для получение кредита на ремонт своего собственного автомобиля. Заранее он благодарит Арванд за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Firuzjon is a young and hardworking 28-year-old young man. He was born in a worker's family in the town of Istaravshan. Firuzjon is married and has two children. He has a very friendly family. They try hard to raise their children to be good people. Firuzjon and his family live in a house that he built himself. Firuzjon is a taxi driver. He has been involved in this business for two years and knows all the nuances of this business. Firuzjon wants to repair his car and needs money to do so. This is why he came to Arvand to obtain a loan to repair his own car. He thanks Arvand for the support and trust in advance.

loans.use: to buy spare parts in order to repair his car

loans.name: Norol

texts.en:
Norol is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs a general store in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, and sugar. Norol has been in this business for 10 years. She also earns income from farming rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Norol has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, like shampoo, soap, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Dope

texts.fr: Agée de 37 ans, Dopé est une femme mariée et mère de trois enfants. Dopé habite à Attiégou et vend des produits alimentaire dans son quartier. Pour disposer du stock en permanence, Dopé s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au grand marché. Dopé souhaite répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients. Dopé demande ce crédit pour acheter des cartons  de bonbons et disposer d’une rentabilité pour couvrir ses charges quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Dopé is 37 years old, married, and a mother of three children. She lives in Attiégou and works selling food products in her area.

To maintain a stable level of stock, she procures her goods twice a month at the grand market. 

Dopé wishes to meet to her customers' needs. She is seeking a loan to buy boxes of candy. Earnings will be used to cover her everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy three boxes of candy

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Akoua est une femme divorcée et âgée de 38 ans. Akoua vit avec ses deux enfants dans le quartier d’Attiégou. Akoua désire contribuer activement à l’épanouissement de ses enfants qui sont à sa charge et vend de la boisson locale communément appelée Tchoukoutchou préparée à base du mil. Cette activité lui génère un gain favorable afin de venir en aider aux besoins de son foyer. Akoua s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter les sacs de mil, Akoua sollicite ce crédit pour son financement et réaliser une bonne rentabilité pour favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akoua is 38 years old and divorced. She lives with her two children in the Attiégou neighborhood. 

Akoua wants to actively contribute to her children's development and works selling a local drink commonly called Tchoukoutchou, which is prepared from a base of millet. This work earns enough to cover the household expenses.

Akoua procures ingredients twice a month at the market. In order to buy sacs of millet, Akoua is seeking this loan, from which returns will be used to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy two sacs of millet

loans.name: Treng's Group

texts.en: Treng’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Treng makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as farm laborer to support his family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and woman to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Muti

texts.en:
Muti is a 36-year-old mother with five children. She owns and operates a small business of selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years.

Muti has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a fry pan to assist her in running the business.

She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. Muti joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a fry pan.

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
Filipina is a 47-year-old mother with two children. She owns and operates a small business of cooking and selling BBQ in her community to earn a living.

Filipina has requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, bananas, and a sack of rice to help her run the business.

Filipina hopes to build a small restaurant in the near future using her business profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, bananas, and a sack of rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hay to store and resell later

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy banana tubes, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is 38 years old, married and has one child. His wife manages their retail business. Alex wants to expand their bakery and general merchandise business. Hence, he is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy flour, margarine, sugar, and other ingredients used in making breads. Alex is also planning to use the loan to buy a variety of grocery items for their retail business. He is hoping that someday he will be able to expand the business and provide a better future for his family. He will work to attain his goal.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread and to buy grocery items for retail.

loans.name: Gloria Fatima

texts.es:
Sin mucho capital, Gloria montó su taller de confección con el ánimo de generar ingresos con los cuales pueda sostener los gastos de su hogar donde convive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo. 
La actividad la aprendió realizando algunos cursos y esto le ha permitido realizar trabajos que se caracterizan por su buena calidad y su puntualidad en la entrega. 
Con sus trabajos, Gloria ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes que le han garantizado muy buenas ventas mensuales, por lo que espera que su negocio siga creciendo y posteriormente pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. 
Con la finalidad de responder a la demanda sus clientes, Gloria busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una maquina plana.
Gloria espera que así su familia pueda gozar de unos mejores ingresos los cuales les permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida y una educación de mejor calidad. 
Además, Gloria espera que si su negocio sigue ampliándose a un buen ritmo y que en su taller pueda generar como mínimo un empleo para una persona que lo requiera y no tenga oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Gloria started her sewing business with very little capital and a desire to earn an income with which to provide for her household where she lives with her two children and her husband.  She learned this trade through various classes.  This has allowed her to establish her work for its high quality and timeliness.  Through her work, Gloria has been able to gain a lot of customers, which guarantees her great sales.  She hopes that her business continues to grow so that she can create jobs for people in need.

With the goal of fulfilling her customers' demands, Gloria is seeking a loan so that she can purchase a sewing machine.  Gloria hopes that it will allow her family to enjoy greater earnings so that they can improve their quality of life and her children can receive a high quality education. Furthermore, Gloria hopes that if her business continues to grow steadily she will be able to create at least one job for someone in need who is currently unemployed.

loans.use: purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sifaga

texts.en:
Sifaga is a 26-year-old mother with one child. She has a small business sewing clothes and selling them in her community to earn a living. 

Sifaga  has requested a loan to buy rolls of material, needles, a sewing machine and tape measures to help her with the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. She will use her profit to expand her business. 

Sifaga became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a rolls of material, needles, a sewing machine and tape measures.

loans.name: San Martin Group

texts.es:
19 son las que integran este grupo, son mujeres jefas de familia, muy luchadoras y trabajadoras, están en su ciclo 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, con el que quieren ir mejorando cada día.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lilian , quien a través del esfuerzo y por medio de las ventas que hace viene mejorando cada día. Ella vende prendas variadas, y con los ingresos que tiene ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Lilian  solicita de este préstamo para la compra de  Blusas, Remeras, Pantalones, Bermudas; entre otros; lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Nineteen people belong to this group, all women who are heads of families, plus very combative and hard-working. They are in their first loan cycle with the Women's Committee by means of which they wish to improve themselves each day.

One of the members is Lilian, who by her own efforts and the sales she makes is bettering herself daily. She sells a variety of clothing, and with the income she receives, Lilian helps her family and her dear loved ones.

Lilian is requesting a loan to purchase blouses, T-shirts, pants, and Bermuda shorts, among other items of clothing, that will help her solidify her business plan and improve her income.

loans.use: buy blouses, T-shirts, pants, Bermuda shorts and other items of clothing for resale.

loans.name: El Pozito Comercio Group

texts.es:
El Pozito Comercio es un grupo de préstamo que se conformó en una comunidad muy pacífica, los habitantes son personas muy amables y trabajadoras. Desde el camino que se recorre para llegar al lugar, se pueden apreciar las grandes extensiones de invernaderos de nopales ya que la siembra de este producto es una de las principales actividades.

Maricruz  tiene 28 años, es muy reservada pero dedicada y tiene un pequeño de 2 años que aún no asiste a la escuela. Desde pequeña, los padres de Maricruz le enseñaron a entender y vivir el mundo de los negocios. “Mi padres siempre han sido comerciantes, cuando no tenían con quien dejarnos, yo y mis hermanos también ayudábamos en lo que podíamos”. 

Cuando escuchó hablar de VisionFund México, decidió solicitar un préstamo para iniciar un negocio propio, aunque fue difícil decidir el tipo de mercancía, finalmente eligió productos de limpieza y productos de plástico para el hogar como trapos para cocina, tenedores, cucharas, pinzas para ropa y cubetas entre otros, en los que invertirá nuevamente su préstamo. Hoy en día Maricruz, ya cuenta con 9 años de experiencia en esta actividad.

Ella vende caminando entre las calles de la capital del país donde no hay tanta competencia como en su comunidad. Para aprovechar el tiempo, renta un pequeño cuarto junto con su esposo y sólo regresa a casa en momentos determinados. Durante la temporada de lluvia, el negocio se ve un poco afectado por las ventas bajas, pero Maricruz no se desanima con la situación, ya que sabe que esa época también termina y las ganancias vuelven a mejorar. 

Su sueño es vender en mayor cantidad para incrementar sus ganancias y poder construir una casa más grande en su comunidad, tal vez tener un local y dejar de viajar tanto.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son Juana quien inviertirá en bolsas de mandado; Hilaria, en plásticos y fibras; Lourdes, en jarcería; Celia, en su tienda de abarrotes; Audifren, en cacerolas y Armando, en su panadería.

*La fotografía fue tomada afuera de la casa de Maricruz, ella es quien tiene el sombrero y una abrigo negro*
texts.en:
"El Pozito Comercio" is a lending group that was formed in a very peaceful community who residents are very kind and hardworking.  From the road that leads to this community, one can see the huge cactus greenhouses since this product is one of the main economic activities of the region.

Maricruz is 28 years old, she is very reserved but very dedicated to her work.  She has a two year old son who is not yet in school.  From a young age, Maricruz's parents taught her how to understand and live in the business world.  "My parents have always been business people.  When they did not have someone to leave us with, my siblings and I would help them however we could."  When she heard about VisionFund Mexico, she decided to seek a loan to start her business with.  Although it was difficult to decide what kind of business to start, she ultimately chose to sell cleaning supplies and plastic products for home use such as dish towels, forks, spoons, clothespins, buckets, etc. She will use this loan to purchase these products.

Maricruz has nine years of experience in this business.  She sells her products in the streets of the capital, where there is less competition than there is in her town.  In order to take make the most of her time, she rents a small room with her husband and only returns home at designated times.  During the rainy season, the business is affected by the decrease in sales, but Maricruz is not discouraged by the situation since she knows that the season will end and her earnings will increase again.  

Her dream is to sell in greater quantities so that she can increase her sales and build a larger house in her town, or possibly get a bigger store and stop traveling as much.  

The other members of the group are: Juana, who will purchase grocery bags; Hilaria, who will purchase plastic and thread; Lourdes, who will purchase ropes; Celia, who will invest in her grocery store; Audifen, who will purchase pans; and Armando, who will invest in his bakery.

The picture was taken outside of Maricruz's house, she is wearing a hat and a black jacket.

loans.use: purchase cleaning supplies and plastic products.

loans.name: Merlelyn

texts.en:
Merlelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a restaurant business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat, canned goods, spices, etc. for her restaurant business.

Merlelyn has been in this business for 14 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Merlelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat, canned goods, spices, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Susan works hard to support her family.  She has a  business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Susan is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell in her charcoal business.  She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nexhare

texts.en:
Nexhare lives in an Ashakali community, is married and a mother of four children; three boys and one girl. In order to earn a living, her husband works in a cleaning company, but with a low salary that is not enough to provide for his family's needs, especially with four children. As a way to help her family, Nexhare makes traditional wedding clothing in her community. She enjoys this business but her work is very slow and inconsistent until the summer wedding seasons and she struggles to provide a secure income during the off seasons.  

For this reason she is requesting a loan in order to purchase a milk cow so that she can start to sell milk and dairy products in her community for extra income and provide the products to her family to save on expenses. She is very happy and looking forward to starting a new business. She hopes that she will be able to add more cows and expand her farm in the future. She is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow so that she can start to sell milk and dairy products in her community for extra income and provide the products to her family to save on expenses

loans.name: Rana

texts.en: Rana is a 53-year-old pensioner. She is married and has three sons. All of her sons are married and live with their families but they help their mother to cover some living costs. Rana earns a living raising and selling turkeys. She has worked in this area for 33 years and has good experience and earns 170 AZN monthly. She raises them, fattens them and then sells to restaurants, local bazaars or cafes. Rana loves farming very much and she wants to expand her business. She wants to buy and raise chickens as well. This will increase productivity and the income of the family. She applied for a 1500 AZN loan in order to purchase good quality birdseed and chickens.

loans.use: to purchase good quality birdseed and chickens.

loans.name: Oloitiefu

texts.en:
Oloitiefu is 57 years old, with two children. To earn a living, she operates a business, selling bananas and taro in her community. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Oloitiefu has requested a loan to buy banana tubes, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her in running the business. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2012 and hopes to use her business profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy twist ties , chicken, flour,  sugar,  rice,  tinned fish,  vegetable oil,  milk,  sausage and plastic bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay his matriculation and other academic fees at the university.

loans.name: Ma. Brinlle

texts.en:
Ma. Brinlle is 35 years old and married with three children.  She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.  Ma. Brinlle has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She has been running the general store for one year, and also earns an income from fishing.  She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Ma. Brinlle aspires to saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is a 32-year-old mother of 2 children.  She runs a small business providing good transportation services to people. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Ruby has requested for a loan to buy new wheels, paint, car seat, and air condition to help her provide good services. 

She hopes to use her profits to buy another taxi and expand her business in the near future. 

Ruby became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy new wheels, paint, car seat, and air condition

loans.name: Leapuna

texts.en:
Leapuna is a 40-year-old mother of 3 children.  She runs a small business providing good transportation services to people. She has been doing this for more than 2 years.

Leapuna has requested a loan to buy new wheels, paint, car seat, air condition, and license registration to help her maintain and provide the good services. 

She hopes to use her profits to buy another taxi and expand her business in the near future.

Leapuna became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy new wheels, paint, car seat, air condition, and license registration

loans.name: Falaseesee

texts.en:
Falaseesee is a 38-year-old mother of 2 children.  She owns and operates a small business selling pancake, pork cake, and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. 

Falaseesee has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoons, and a frying pan for her business operations.

She hopes to use her profits to build a small bakery store in the near future. 

Falaseesee joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoons, and a frying pan

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 60-year-old mother of 8 children. She runs a small business cooking bananas and fried chicken and sells them in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. 

Lina has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a box of curry, a box of chicken, a sack of rice, a bottle of vegetable oil, a gas stove, a sack of potatoes, a sack of onions, plastics bags, and a container to help her run the business. 

Lina will use her profits to build a small restaurant in the near future. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2003.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a box of curry, a box of chicken, a sack of rice, a bottle of vegetable oil, a gas stove, a sack of potatoes, a sack of onions, plastics bags, and a container

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta is a 42-year-old mother of 11 children. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. 

Eseta has requested a loan to buy bananas, taro roots, wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals she needs to run the business. 

She joined SPBD in 2013, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Popoai

texts.en:
Popoai is a 38-year-old mother with five children.  She has a small business selling vegetables, such as cabbage, eggplant and cucumber, in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a  year. 

Popoai has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to assist her in running the business.   Popoai hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future.  

She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots.

loans.name: Gessica

texts.es:
Gessica actualmente vive con sus padres y una hermana, trabaja en un autoservice para poder solventar sus estudios.
A la vez que estudia también trabaja, es una persona que se sacrifica mucho para poder crecer y salir adelante. Ella está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, de manera a ser una profesional útil a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y poder seguir con sus metas.
texts.en:
Gessica currently lives with her parents and her sister. She works in an auto service to pay for her studies, working and studying at the same time.  She is a person who has sacrificed much so she can grow and succeed.

She is studying a career in accounting in order to be a useful professional in society. She is asking for this loan so she can pay for the fees of her career and continue to follow her goals.

loans.use: to pay for college fees.

loans.name: Lesitala

texts.en:
Lesitala is 58-years-old of 5 children. She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 3 years.

Lesitala has requested a loan to buy bananas, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals she needs to run the business. 

She joined SPBD in 2008, and hopes to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 23-year-old single lady from a village near Jenin city. She lives with her family in a small house. Amal works as an employee at a local firm. She also works with her family on their agricultural land. They plant seasonal fruits and vegetables. Amal took a loan from FATEN, which will help her to buy more seedlings and fertilizers for the family farm. By taking this loan, Amal will be able to increase the family's income and improve their living condition. Amal appears in the photo on the family farm.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings and fertilizers for the family farm.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Maria has been in this business for three years. Maria earns more income from raising pigs. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net.

loans.name: Avau

texts.en:
Avau is 47 years old with six children. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. 

She has been doing this for more than two years. Avau has requested a loan to buy banana tube, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel and chemicals to assist her in running the business. 

She joined SPBD in 2005, and hopes to use her business profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel and chemicals.

loans.name: Cintia

texts.es:
Cintia es una persona que se esta esforzando por ser alguien en la vida, lucha por sus hijos para poder darles una vida digna y sin privaciones, esta estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, que ella sabe le permitirá abrirse camino. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en pagar sus cuotas, lo que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente las cuotas de su universidad, de manera a poder seguir con su lucha.
texts.en:
Cintia is a person who is striving to be someone in life, motivated by her children, in order that she can give them a dignified life without privations.  She is studying accounting, a career which she knows will open doors for her.  She says that she used the previous loan to pay her school fees, which was of great help to her.

She is asking for this loan to be able to again pay her school fees at the university, so that she will be able to continue persevering towards her goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Gautaala

texts.en:
Gautalaa is a 54-year-old mother of 6 children and has a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. 

Gautaala has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots she needs to run the business. 

Gautaala hopes to expand her business by using her profits in the near future. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2008.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots

loans.name: Tuinanau

texts.en:
Tuinanau is 24 years old and has 1 child. 

She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Tuinanau has requested a loan to buy bananas, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals she needs to run the business. 

She joined SPBD in 2015, and hopes to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Vaimaila

texts.en:
Vaimaila is 49 years old and has 2 children. 

She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Vaimaila has requested a loan to buy bananas, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals she needs to run the business. 

She joined SPBD in 2015, and hopes to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is 36 years old and has 4 children. 

She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Anastasia has requested a loan to buy bananas, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals she needs to run the business. 

She joined SPBD in 2015, and hopes to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Nilsa

texts.es:
Nilsa es de la ciudad de Villarrica, está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, es una persona que se esfuerza para ser alguien en la vida y con sus estudios ayudar a su familia.
Es una mujer que se esfuerza mucho por ser una profesional útil, no solo a si misma, sino también a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir su meta de crecer.
texts.en:
Nilsa is from the city of Villarrica.  She is studying accounting.  She is a person who strives to be someone in life, and with her studies help her family.

She is a woman who strives a lot to be a useful professional, not only for herself, but also for the society.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay the fees for her degree, and with them, be able to continue her goal to grow.

loans.use: To buy university fees.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania vive con sus padres, ella es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo, es una persona muy sacrificada que está poniendo todo de si para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Comenta que cada tiene más trabajos que presentar en la universidad y que le es muy difícil por no tener los medios para poder afrontarlo, es por ello que pide este préstamo, para poder comprar una notebook, de manera a poder seguir con su universidad, y cumplir con los trabajos de la universidad.
texts.en:
Tania lives with her parents.  She is from the city of Curuguaty.  She studies and works at the same time.  She is a very self-sacrificing person who is giving her all to be able to grow and get ahead.

She says that each has more assignments to present in the university, and that it is difficult for her to not have the means to be able to cope with it.  This is why she is requesting this loan to be able to buy a Notebook, in order to continue with her university and to complete the assignments in the university.

loans.use: To buy a Notebook.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon and a fry pan

loans.name: Siolo

texts.en: Siolo is 43 years old with 5 children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Siolo has requested a loan to buy banana tube, taro roots, wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals to support her business. She joined SPBD in 2015, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube, taro roots, wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals for her business.

loans.name: Melchor

texts.es:
El Sr. Melchor tiene 55 años, vive en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, es Técnico en electrónica, anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa donde viajo al exterior para especializarse y hace 30 años que se independizo, tiene 2 hijas una ya se recibió de Abogada y la otra está en el colegio.
Su sueño es que sus hijas sean profesionales para poder ser personas útiles a la sociedad. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar repuestos, y de esa forma usar en su taller. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Melchor is 55 years old.  He lives in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  He is a technician in electronics.  Previously, he worked in a business where he traveled abroad to specialize himself, and 30 years ago he became independent.  

He has two daughters, one just became a lawyer and the other is still in school.  His dream is that his daughters become professionals to be able to be useful people to the society.

He is requesting this loan to be able to buy spare parts, and thus use them in his workshop.  He is grateful for the opportunity that he receives to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his workshop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 57 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, and eggs.

Elizabeth has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years.

Elizabeth aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, and eggs

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora works hard to support her family. Debora is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials like net, gasoline, and bamboo.

Debora has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Debora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials like net, gasoline, and bamboo.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie works hard to support her family. Elsie is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Elsie has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Elsie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Hassen

texts.en:
Hassen runs a small grocery in Sana'a city, Yemen in the area where he lives with his family. He has been involved with this business for one and a half years. Hassen is 32 years old, married and a father of 2 children. His grocery lacks of a lot of goods and he can't supply the demands of his customers because of the small capital. Hassen is a soldier in the army but his salary is not enough to cover the necessary expenses of his children as well as to provide his grocery with a lot of goods.

Therefore, he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to buy various goods such as rice, sugar, soap, dairy products and vegetables, canned foods, and soft drinks for his store. Through this loan, he can offer a wider variety to customers and earn more profits that helps him provide his family with a good living condition.

Hassen hopes to expand his business more through opening a large supermarket.

loans.use: to buy goods such as rice, sugar, soap, dairy products and vegetables, canned foods, and soft drinks for his grocery store.

loans.name: Silia

texts.en: Silia is 28 years old with three children. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Silia has requested a loan to buy banana tubers, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her to run the business. She joined SPBD in 2014, and hopes to use her  profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubers, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Inmaculada Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Inmaculada, se formó en la ciudad de Caaguazú, con la unión de amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 10 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema, luchando por poder mejorarla cada día.
Una persona entre ellas es la Sra. Elodia, quien se dedica a vender carbón, por medio de este humilde trabajo lucha por poder tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia, y cubrir todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones. Elodia es una persona luchadora y por sobre todo muy sacrificada. 
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de carbón, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar cada día con su esfuerzo y sacrificio.
texts.en:
The group named Inmaculada was formed in the city of Caaguazu with the coming together of friends and neighbours in the city.  They are doing the Poverty Elimination Survey where 10 members have been found to be under the poverty line, that is to say, in extreme poverty, struggling every day to be able to improve.

One person among them is Senora Elodia, who sells charcoal.  By way of this humble work, she struggles to be able to have the means to help her family and to cover all that they need to have for a dignified life without privations.  Elodia is a person who perseveres, and above all, is very self-sacrificing.

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of charcoal, and in this way to be able to continue with her sales, fighting to improve every day with her efforts and self-sacrifice.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Renacer está en su ciclo número 9 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir que están en una pobreza extrema.
La Sra. Teodora integra este grupo, ella se dedica a las ventas, tiene una despensa bien surtida que monto con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio, es una señora muy luchadora que no se rinde ni deja vencer, quiere dar a su familia todo lo que ella no tuvo, es por eso que quiere capacitarse y poder sobresalir.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder surtir su negocio con verduras, panificados, frutas, leche y otros insumos, de manera a poder seguir dando a sus clientes lo que piden. todas están muy agradecidas por la oportunidad que reciben de poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group called Renacer (Rebirth) is in its 9th cycle of the program committed to women, where all work and help each other to get ahead.  They are doing a program to eliminate poverty, where four of them find themselves below the poverty line, that is to say that they are extremely poor.

The Señora Teodora is part of this group.  She makes a living selling.  She has a well stocked convenience store that she takes care of with a lot of work and sacrifice.  She is a hardworking woman who does not surrender or give up.  She wants to give her family all that she did not have.  It is for that that she wants to train and be able to succeed.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in buying products to be able to stock her business with vegetables, breads, fruits, milk, and other products, in order to be able to continue giving her customers what they ask for.  All of them are very grateful for the opportunity that they receive to be able to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, breads, fruits, milk, and other products.

loans.name: Sinapi

texts.en:
Sinapi is a 31-year-old mother with three children. She owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Sinapi  has  requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a frying pan to assist her to run the business. She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. Sinapi joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, a frying pan

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 32-year-old mother with five children. She runs a small business selling tuna sandwiches and toast sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Fatima has requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, a container, butter, and mayonnaise to assist her with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. Fatima became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, a container, butter, and mayonnaise

loans.name: Las Guapas Group

texts.es:
El Comité La Guapas está en el 5to ciclo, es un grupo excelente grupo, todas ellas son unidas y solidarias y se proyectan para el progreso. Están muy contentas por formar parte del programa de comités de mujeres, ya que a través de las capacitaciones podrán ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
Wilfrida es un ejemplo de lucha, ella se dedica a la costura, hace todo tipo de costuras, en lo que le va muy bien, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante y es por ello que se está esforzando bastante. Comenta que se hizo ya de muy buena clientela, y que siempre le hacen muchos  pedidos, es una mujer muy sacrificada y emprendedora.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, botones y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo y cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe, y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Las Guapas Committee is in its 5th loan cycle. This is an excellent group they are all very united, supportive and their plan is to get ahead. They are very happy to be part of the women committee program where they participate in training workshops that will help them improve the living conditions for them and their families.

Wilfrida is an example of someone who works hard. She makes a living sewing.  She can work with all types of sewing and it is going well. She is a hard working woman who wants to get ahead and this is why she is putting a lot of effort. She mentions that she has made good customers and they place a lot of orders with her.  She is selfless and an entrepreneur.

She request this loan to invest in the purchase of fabrics, threads, buttons and others supplies to be able to complete her customer’s orders.  She appreciates the opportunity she receives, it will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, buttons and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la actividad del cultivo de jocote y loroco, ella tiene 6 años de experiencia en la agricultura, los producto son comercializados en la zona donde reside, la joven es madre soltera y vive en casa propia con su hija y su hermana, ella  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los insumos necesarios para la cosecha como fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plaga y también mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: The young woman whose face is blurred, as she is 29 years old and lives in a high risk area, works growing green peppers and loroco (vine with edible buds and flowers). She has six years experience working in agriculture, and the products are sold in the area where she lives. She is a single mother and lives in her own house with her daughter and her sister. She is asking for a loan to buy the necessary inputs for the harvest, such as fertilisers, manure and pest control products, and also to improve the land that is shown in the photograph and thus have a better income and better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy the necessary inputs for the harvest, such as fertilisers, manure and pest control products, and also to improve her land.

loans.name: Ma. Lilia

texts.en:
Ma. Lilia is a 65-year-old married woman from Leyte. She is engaged in a hog raising business. This is the source of her income. 

She is asking to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed for them. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed for them.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda makes a living through pig raising. The mother of three children from Dulag, Leyte, Nilda has raised pigs for more than 4 years now. This is her income. Her husband is a farmer.  

Nilda would like to take a loan to buy more pigs to raise and animal feed for them. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise and animal feed for them.

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie is a married woman and a mother of a three-year-old child from Leyte, Philippines. She makes a living through a hog raising business. This has been her source of income for more than three years now. 

Angelie would like a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed for them. She believes that this loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed for them.

loans.name: Arje

texts.en:
Arje is a 26-year-old, married man from Leyte, Philippines. He has one child. Arje earns a living through his sari-sari or retail store business. He has operated his store for more than four years now. He would like to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, condiments and cooking oil. 

This loan will enable Arje to improve his stock thus attracting more buyers in his store. In the future,  Arje dreams of making his business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, condiments and cooking oil.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 30 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.  She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Evelyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Evelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for three years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 32 years old and has four children who are in school. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Joy has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional bundles of fishing net. She has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Joy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of fishing net.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 44 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell.

Victoria has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Victoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Odelyn

texts.en:
Odelyn is 37 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, egg, etc.

Odelyn has been in this business for two years.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, egg, etc.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 9 years now.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Pilar would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Sarah has been in this business for 3 years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of frozen foods to sell.

In the future, Sarah would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Shirly has been in this business for 5 years now.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

In the future, Shirly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Fely has been in this business for 7 years now.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net.

In the future, Fely would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She has been in this business for 15 years, and she earns more income from a general store.

Celena is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar, eggs, etc. for her food vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Celena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Letecia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Letecia is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
As a married mother of 4 children, Mary Grace works hard to support her family.

Mary Grace has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from farming rice. She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Miguel, está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, una ciudad rural, aun en crecimiento, donde las integrantes  luchan.
La Señora Hermelinda,  es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la venta de asadito en frente a un polideportivo de la ciudad. Ella con ese trabajo genera ingresos y ayuda a su familia para salir adelante, desea que el grupo y las capacitaciones que reciba le sean de mucha ayuda, ya que con ello ayuda a sus seres queridos.
Solicita  este préstamo para la compra de carnes, condimentos, mandioca, panificados y demás, de manera a poder seguir con la venta de sus asaditos.
texts.en:
This group, named San Miguel, is in its first cycle of the women committee program. It is from the city of Curuguaty, which is a rural city that is still growing. The members of this group work hard.

One of the members is Hermelinda. She makes a living selling grilled foods in front of a sports center in the city. This work allows her to earn an income and to help her family move forward. She hopes that this group as well as the training that she will receive will be of great help to her, since with this she will support her loved ones.

She is requesting a loan to buy meats, condiments, cassava, breads, and more so that she can continue selling her grilled foods.

loans.use: to buy meats, condiments, cassava, breads, and more.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Maria  está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo, formado en la ciudad de Curuguaty, con la unión de varias amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad.
La Sra. Carmen es una de las integrantes, presidenta de este grupo, ella es de una zona alejada del centro mismo de la ciudad donde sale a vender sus postres y también comidas saladas, que ella misma hace. Es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, por ello ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella.
Solicita de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su lucha diaria.
texts.en:
The group called Santa Maria is in its first cycle of the program committed to women.  It is a new group, formed in the city of Curuguaty, with a group of various friends and neighbors from that city.

The Señora Carmen is one of the members.  She is president of this group.  She is from an area far from the center of the city where she goes to sell her desserts and also salty foods that she makes herself.  She is a very good woman in what she does, for that she has very good clientele that always buy from her.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in buying products to be able to make her foods, such as meat, condiments, vegetables, and other things, in order to be able to continue with her daily fight.

loans.use: To buy meat, condiments, vegetables, and other things.

loans.name: Amigas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Amigas” está en su ciclo número 20 Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 7 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con una pobreza extrema, donde luchan por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Elizabeth, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir está en un nivel medio.  Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas varias y con los ingresos que tiene ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos, es una mujer muy luchadora y sacrificada que quiere ir creciendo conforme pase el tiempo.
La Señora pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones y otros, de manera a poder seguir con la venta de prendas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group named “Amigas” (Friends) is in its 20th loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are working and helping one another to move forward. They have also taken the poverty elimination survey, which indicated that seven of the members are below the poverty line. In other words, they are in extreme poverty and are striving to improve their living conditions.

One of the members is Sra. Elizabeth. Her latest survey indicated that she is at a Stage 2 poverty level, which is a moderate level. Elizabeth sells various types of clothes and uses the income to help her family and loved ones. She is a determined and self-sacrificing woman who wants to grow over time.

Sra. Elizabeth is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of T-shirts, jeans, shirts, trousers, and other garments. As a result, she can continue selling clothes just as before.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, jeans, shirts, trousers, and other garments.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en: Enrique is a 63-year-old, married man and a father of 10 children from Leyte, Philippines. He earns a living through his hog raising business. Enrique is asking to take a loan to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise. A loan will help him to improve his business and income.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments and cereals

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
Gorgonia is a 60-year-old, married woman and a mother of three grown up children from Leyte, Philippines. She makes a living through her hog raising business. This has been her source of income for more than 10 years now. 

Gorgonia would like to avail a loan to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise.  She believes that this loan will help her to improve her hog raising business, as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 26-year-old, married woman and a mother of two children from Leyte, Philippines. She makes a living through her snack food vending. Grace cooks snack foods and sells it to the people in her place. This is her source of living. Her husband is a farmer. 

Grace is asking to take a loan to buy more ingredients like flour, sugar, bananas, cooking oil, etc. With this loan she will be able to cook and sell more to her customers, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like flour, sugar, bananas, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is a 44-year-old, sari-sari storeowner from Leyte. For more than two years now, this business has provided her the income that she needs. Jinky would like to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, candies, snack foods, and condiments. 

This loan will help Jinky to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store. She hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, candies, snack foods, and condiments.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
From Leyte, Philippines, Julia is a 58-year-old married mother of 6 grown children. She earns a living through her hog raising business. This has been her source of income for more than 38 years now. 

Julia would like to take a loan to buy both animal feed and additional piglets to raise. 

Julia believes that this loan will help her improve her hog raising business as well as increase her income.

loans.use: to buy feed as well as additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a 43-year-old, married woman and a mother of seven children from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than 22 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Arlene is requesting to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her to improve her business, as well as her income. Arlene hopes to make her business more profitable and stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a 39-year-old, married woman and a mother of four children from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than 10 years now. Angelina is requesting to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. 

This loan will help her to improve her hog raising business, as well as her income. In the future, Angelina hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Ma. Lilibeth

texts.en:
Ma. Lilibeth is a 46-year-old sari-sari (general) store owner from Leyte. For more than 22 years now, this business has provided her with the income that she needs. 

Ma. Lilibeth would like to obtain a loan to buy more groceries to sell at her store, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, candies, snack foods and condiments. This loan will help Ma. Lilibeth in improving her inventory, thus attracting more buyers to her store. 

Ma. Lilibeth hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell at her store, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, candies, snack foods and condiments.

loans.name: Portia

texts.en:
Portia is a 36-year-old married woman and mother of a four-year-child, and is from Leyte, Philippines. Portia runs a small retail business selling canned goods, noodles, and rice. This is her source of income. 

Portia is asking for a loan to buy more goods for resale, like canned goods, noodles and rice. This loan will help her improve her inventory, thus attracting more buyers to her store.

loans.use: to buy more goods for resale, like canned goods, noodles and rice.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a 28-year-old sari-sari (general) store owner from Leyte. For more than three years now, this business has provided her with the income that she needs. 

Teresa would like to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell at her store, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, candies, snack foods and condiments. This loan will help Teresa in improving her stock of goods, thus attracting more buyers to her store. 

Teresa hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell at her store, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, candies, snack foods and condiments.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is a 62-year-old married woman and a mother of four grown children. She is from Leyte, Philippines. She makes a living through her hog raising business. This has been her source of income for more than ten years now. 

Trinidad would like to request a loan to buy additional piglets to raise, and to buy animal feed. She believes that this loan will help her improve her hog raising business, as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise, and to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma, 39, is a rice farmer from Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has five children. For more than four years now, farming has provided her the income that she needs. Emma is asking to take a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Emma believes that the loan will help her improve the productivity of her farm, as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is a 45-year-old married woman who owns a sari-sari store (general store) in Leyte. For more than three years now, this business has provided her the income that she needs. Rowena would like to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, candies, snack foods, and condiments. This loan will help Rowena to improve her inventory, attracting more buyers in her store. Rowena hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, etc.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is a 65-year-old married mother of 4 grown children from Leyte, Philippines. 

For more than 10 years now, Soledad has been engaged in her business raising hogs. This is the main source of her income. 

Soledad is requesting a loan to buy animal feed and more piglets to raise. This loan will help her improve her business as well as her income. 

Soledad hopes to make her business more profitable and stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy both animal feed as well as more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando lives in a community in the Department of Copan Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (coffee and corn) since 14 years ago. Age 34 years; He is married and has five children. It is clear that Orlando works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his children will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.
Orlando is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, de 49 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 5 hijos, su esposa se dedica  a los oficios del hogar y a cuidar de sus hijos, todos van a la escuela.


Migue, trabaja en la agricultura, produciendo  sus propios alimentos, por las pocas oportunidades de trabajo en el lugar donde vive, tiene que acudir a otras fuentes que no son muy valoradas, pero a pesar de todo busca siempre una alternativa que genere ingreso económico para solventar las necesidades de su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Miguel is 49 years old, married, and has five children. His wife looks after the household chores and takes care of their children, all of whom are in school.

Miguel farms, producing his own food. Because of the few employment opportunities in the place where he lives, he has to turn to other sources of income that are not very well paid.

But in spite of everything, he is always looking for an alternative that will generate income to pay for his family's needs. The loan is to improve his home.

loans.use: To make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a small solar home system to replace candle and ocote (dry wood) consumption and improve their live's quality

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastian, estudio hasta 7° grado de educacion basica, esta acompañado y su pareja trabaja en los oficios domesticos, tiene un hijo que vive con el y trabaja. 

Sebastian, es empleado por más de 8 años y decidio trabajar para sostener economicamente a su familia.- Tambien hace viajes en su pick up.- Antes tenia tienda. La distancia no se puede medir porque viaja a distintos pueblos en su pick up. Le apoya su compañera de vida.

Sebastian, necesita el crédito para construir una vivienda, le mejorara mucho su condicion de vida porque sera de mejor calidad.

Sus sueños son trabajar lo mejor que pueda para darle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Sebastian studied through the seventh grade of his basic education. He is in a relationship and his partner takes care of the household duties. Sebastian has a son who is working and lives with him.

Sebastian has been employed for more than eight years. He decided to work in order to financially support his family. Sebastian also makes delivery trips with his pickup truck. Prior to that, he owned a store. Distance cannot be measured because he travels to different towns in his pickup. His companion in life also helps him.

Sebastian needs a loan in order to build a home. This will great improve his living conditions because they will be of better quality. His dreams include working the best he can so that he can provide a better future for his family.

loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Matias

texts.en:
Matias lives in a community in the Department of Copan Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (coffee and beans) since 15 years ago. He is 38 years old; He is married and has four children. It is clear that Matias works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his children will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.
Matias is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en: A passionate and active businesswoman, Victorina is 68 years old an married. She is always looking for ways to succeed and strives to improve the living conditions of her family. She cares about the welfare of her clients, who want to sell or buy a house or an apartment but do not know how or want to avoid fraud. For this reason, she owns a business that is dedicated to advising people on the purchase and sale of real estate. She is requesting a loan of MXN 7,000 to cover operating expenses and purchase supplies for her office in order to provide a higher quality service. Victorina would like to expand her customer base in the region to achieve financial stability through a diverse portfolio of property buyers and seller. She is a woman who consideres herself very responsible in planning her financial obligations and is confident in making successful repayments on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to cover operating expenses and to purchase supplies for the office.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en: Madelyn is a 42-year-old, married woman and a mother of eight children from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now.
