This is the source of her income. Madelyn is asking to take a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks. A loan will help them improve their fishing business, as well as income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is a 42-year-old, married woman and a mother of two children from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She earns a living through her hog raising business. She has been in the business for more than two years now. Elsie is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her to improve her business, as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Menard

texts.en:
Menard is a fisherman living in Carles, Iloilo. He is married and has been in the business for more than two years now. Menard is standing next to materials for making a new fishing boat. 

Menard is requesting a loan to buy more materials to make a new fishing boat, like wood, nails, epoxy adhesives, paints, outriggers, and other items. A loan will help him improve his business as well as his income.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make a new fishing boat, like wood, nails, epoxy adhesives, paints,outriggers, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of new and different phone accessories for his a small  store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover his tuition for this semester.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es una persona que se esta esforzando para poder salir adelante y por medio de sus estudios poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar sus gastos de manutención, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, ya que con el podrá cubrir ese gasto que tiene.Agradece por la nueva oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Sandra is a person who is striving to get ahead. Through her studies, she wants to help her loved ones. She says that her previous loan was used to pay her living expenses, which was a great help.

Sandra is requesting a new loan so that she can invest in the payment of her degree fees that are outstanding. She appreciates this new opportunity she has received so that she can continue studying.

loans.use: to pay her degree fees.

loans.name: Mango Poty Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo llamado Mango Poty, ellas son mujeres de familia muy luchadoras y emprendedoras, forman parte del programa de comités, y también del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Teodolina, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno. Lo que quiere decir que ella está en una pobreza extrema. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace y que luego sale a vender de manera ambulante.
Teodolina pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, con lo cual podrá seguir haciendo las delicias que prepara, y con ello poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group, named Mango Poty, is composed of 17 women. They are very hard-working and entrepreneurial women who are dedicated to their families. They are part of the committee program as well as the poverty elimination program.

One of the members is Teodolina. In her last survey, she demonstrated a poverty level within level 1. This means that she is in extreme poverty. She makes a living selling foods that she prepares and then later sets out to sell as a street merchant. 

Teodolina is requesting a loan to buy supplies to make her foods, such as meats, condiments, vegetables, and more. With this, she will be able to continue preparing the foods that she sells, which will allow her to fill her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy meats, condiments, vegetables, and more.

loans.name: Merva

texts.en: Merva is a fish vendor from Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and has three children. Merva has been in the business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income. Merva is asking to take a loan to buy more fish to sell.  She believes that a loan will help her to improve her business, as well as her profits.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Siti, who lives with her husband and two sons in Bandung, a semi-urban area located about three hours’ drive from Jakarta. She owns a small stall where she sells daily consumer products and provides mobile payment services for her community. She is a cheerful and hardworking woman, and her customers see her as a trusted mobile provider.

Siti joined Ruma in 2013 when she learned about it from a sales executive who came to her stall. She is applying for a 800,000 IDR loan, her second from Kiva through Rumi. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends.

With support from Ruma’s staff, Siti is seeing some improvements in her business. Kiva’s loans will be very useful to help Siti improve her business, and accordingly, her community that needs access to such services.

As seen in the photo, Siti is the one who is smiling and standing in her own small stall. She is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for her community

loans.name: Servio Tulio

texts.es:
Servio es un hombre que se encuentra desempleado, desesperado, tiene 38 años de edad un pequeño de 4 años y, el busco en apoyo para iniciar un negocio que será una tienda de abarrotes, con el monto solicitado el construirá su local con madera y latas. 
Su negocio será de mucha ayuda el tendrá un medio para sostener su familia.
El sueña con una vida más digna, que su hijo crezca en un buen entorno y ser feliz cada día.
texts.en:
Servio is an unemployed man who is separated from his spouse. He is 38 years old and has a four-year-old son. Servio is seeking assistance so that he can start a business, a grocery store. The amount he is requesting will be used to build a shop out of wood and tin roofing sheets.

His business will a great help since it will allow him to support his family. Servio dreams of having a decent life so that his son can grow up in a good environment and be happy each day.

loans.use: to build a shop out of wood and tin roofing sheets so that he can open a grocery store.

loans.name: Suyani

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Suyani, who lives with her husband and two children in Bandung, a semi-urban area located about two hours’ drive from Jakarta. She owns a small stall where she provides mobile payment services for her community.

Suyani joined Ruma in 2013 and has taken out and successfully repaid two prior loans through Ruma. The second loan helped her to process more mobile phone transactions for her community, and she thanks all lenders for her ability to do so. This third loan will be for 4,000,000 IDR to be used to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends.

With support from Ruma’s staff, Suyani sees some improvements in her business. As it grows, she is hoping to get more loans from Kiva to continue her business’s growth. Your loan will be very useful to help Suyani to do so and accordingly, her community that needs access to such services.

As seen in the photo, Suyani is here sitting at her desk. She is very thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to her community

loans.name: Ma'mun

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Ma’mun. Ma’mun lives in East Bandung, located about three hours' drive from Jakarta. He owns a small stall where he sells daily consumer products and provides mobile payment services for his community. His community sees him as a trusted, friendly, and informative mobile payment service provider.

Ma’mun joined Ruma in 2013. He knew Ruma from one of the sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to try another business opportunity, as well as increase his savings and contribute more to his community. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Ma’mun sees improvements in his business. As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community. This loan will be very useful to help Ma’mun improve his business and, therefore, his community, which needs access to such services. 

In the photo, Ma’mun is standing in his own small stall. He is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community

loans.name: Imron

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Imron. Imron lives in East Bandung, located about a three-hour drive from Jakarta. He owns a small stall where he sells daily consumer products and provides mobile payment services for his community. His community sees him as a trusted, friendly and informative mobile payment service provider.

Imron joined Ruma since 2013. He knew Ruma from one of the sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma, because he wants to try another business opportunity, as well as increase his saving and give more contribution to his community. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Imron sees improvements in his business. 

As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Imron improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services.  As seen in the photo, Imron is the one who is sitting in his own small stall. He is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Ani.  Ani lives in Bandung, a semi-urban area located about a three-hour drive from Jakarta. She lives there with her husband and her son. She owns a small stall where she sells mobile airtime credits and provides mobile payment services for her community. 

Ani joined Ruma in 2013. She knew about Ruma from a sales executive who came to her stall. She decided to join Ruma because she had already heard that Ruma has the best service, and she wanted to expand her business, as well as give more contribution to her community.

With a support from Ruma’s staff, Ani sees improvements in her business. As the business grows, she is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. 

Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Ani improves her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Ani is the one who is standing in her own stall. She is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for her community.

loans.name: Andi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Andi. Andi lives in East Bandung, located about a three-hour drive from Jakarta. He manages a small stall where he sells mobile phone's accessories, mobile airtime credits, and provides mobile payment services for his community. Andi is a young guy who has a big spirit in business. He joined Ruma in 2013. He knew about Ruma from one of the sales executives who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to increase his saving and give more contribution to his community. 

This is the second time Andi is asking for a loan from Kiva. The previous loan helped him to process more mobile transactions for his community, and he thanks all of the lenders because of it. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Andi sees improvements in his business. As the business grows, he is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community. 

Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Andi improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services.  As seen in the photo, Andi is the one who is standing and smiling in his own small stall. He is very thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community.

loans.name: Elnaz

texts.en:
Elnaz is a 53-year-old farmer. She is married and has a son and two daughters. The family lives in a farm. Her husband is a farmer too, and they help each other. They keep cattle. They raise them, fatten them and then sell the milk and meat. Their children also support them in farming. The son helps in the stall and the girls help their mother to make milk, yoghurt and other dairy products. 

Elnaz sells the products to local markets and bazaars. She has worked in farming for 15 years and her monthly income from the family business is 170 AZN. She has applied for 1,500 AZN loan in order to rebuild the cow stall, because it's old and in bad condition. The family plans to expand their small business in the future and supply their products to the other cities and regions too.

loans.use: to rebuild the cow stall because it is old and in bad condition.

loans.name: El Sol Group

texts.es:
El grupo El sol  está en su primer  ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza donde 7 de las 18 señoras  se encuentran con una pobreza extrema.
La señora Zunilda es una de las mujeres que se encuentra en un nivel de pobreza extremo, para poder mejorar ha  realizado una capacitación para poder crecer y mejorar. Ella se dedica a las ventas y tiene una pequeña despensa muy surtida donde hace sus ventas todos los días.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su despensa, como ser leches, panificados, verduras, frutas y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group named “El Sol” (The Sun) is in its first loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members have taken the poverty elimination survey and the results indicated that 7 of the 18 women are in extreme poverty.

Sra. Zunilda is one of the women who is at an extreme poverty level. She is taking a training seminar so that she can grow and improve. Zunilda is in the retail trade and has a small food pantry that is well stocked. She conducts sales from her business every day.

Zunilda is requesting a loan in order to buy products for her food pantry such as milk, baked goods, vegetables, fruits, and other items. She appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can keep growing.

loans.use: to buy milk, baked goods, vegetables, fruits, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is married and works hard to support her family. For the past fifteen years she has sold firewood in the Philippines.

Bernadeth has applied for a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell. She is striving to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria, 27, is a married woman with two children in school. For the past ten years she has bought and sold charcoal and firewood in the Philippines to help support her family.

Candelaria has applied for a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more firewood and charcoal to sell to her customers. She is working hard to save enough money so she will be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more rice and sugar

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 43 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, cooking oil, soft drinks, etc. 

Arlene has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Arlene aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, cooking oil, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Maria Eunice

texts.es:
María es una ama de casa de 42 años de edad que aprovecha las instalaciones de su hogar para ofertar sus productos de venta de mercancía por catálogo de uso personal como lo son desodorantes, talcos para pies y cuerpo, perfumes, espuma para afeitar, pijamas, lociones, su actividad la inicio por necesidad económica es madre de dos hijos menores de edad y su esposo con su salario no era capaz de abarcar con todos los gastos del hogar y desde que María tiene dicha actividad ha sabido trabajar en equipo junto con su esposo para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Pensando en seguir por el buen camino que su hijos estudien, reparar la casa María quiere solicitar un préstamo para abarcar un pedido grande que la tiene muy contenta con ella comprara lociones, perfumes y accesorios, su sueño es poder montar un negocio propio
texts.en:
María is a 42-year-old housewife who takes advantage of the space in her home to sell catalog merchandise. These items include personal use products such as deodorants, foot powders, body talcum, perfumes, shaving cream, pajamas, and lotions. She started her business out of financial necessity because she is the mother of two young children. Her husband earns a salary, but it is not enough to cover all of the household expenses. Since starting this business, María says that she and her husband have been able to work together as a team in order to improve the living conditions of their family.

María wants to support her children’s studies so that they can continue down the right path and also make repairs to her house. She is requesting a loan in order to pay for a large order. María is pleased that she will be able to buy lotions, perfumes, and accessories. Her dream is to establish her business.

loans.use: to buy lotions, perfumes, and accessories.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Lina, who lives in East Bandung, a semi-urban area located about three hours’ drive from Jakarta. She is married and has two children, a daughter and a son. Lina has a cheerful, kind personality, as well as a strong will to improve her life and increase the family’s savings.

In 2013 she joined Ruma. She feels that it has helped her a lot to learn how to manage a business. As her business grows, Lina is hoping to get a 1,500,000 IDR loan from Kiva through Ruma. She will use it to provide more mobile payment services to her community.

Your loan will be very useful in helping Lina improve her business and accordingly, her community that needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Lina is the one who is standing and smiling. She will be thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for her community

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Sinat, 28, lives in a community of Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has two children in total. To support the family, she opened a small store in her community to sell fruits. So far, she has been in this type of business for almost ten years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

As a supplementary income, she came up with a new business idea. She wants to raise cows for sale. However, her insufficient capital investment doesn't allow her to do so. Therefore, she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy cows. She hopes that this new trade will help to improve her living standard.

She is thankful to all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Flor De Pera Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE PERA” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de fruta, venta de comida, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria es integrante, ella indica hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, por herencia de sus padres, mismos que trabajaban con este negocio y ella apoyaba desde niña.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semillas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a lo cultivará para posteriormente realizar la cosecha. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank named “Flor de Pera” (Pear Flower) is starting its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Community Center. This group consists of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Maria serves as its president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling fruit, selling food, and selling clothes.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Maria. She says that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago after receiving an invitation through a mass promotion that was conducted by the organization in her area. Maria currently has a business in which she sells fruit. She is knowledgeable about his business because she learned the trade several years ago from her parents who were in the same line of work. Maria helped them when she was a girl.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying seeds in bulk. She will acquire them from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and then cultivate her land for a future harvest. Working in this manner enables her to generate income for supporting her family financially. Maria is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Maria said that she enjoys the training seminars offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy seeds in bulk.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
Daisy es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, está estudiando la carrera de Contabilidad, ella está luchando para poder ser una profesional útil a la sociedad y también para su familia.
Una vez terminada su carrera quiere poder montar su propio estudio contable para poder servir a la sociedad por medio de sus conocimientos.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, con lo cual podrá cubrir ese gasto que tiene. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Daisy is from the city of Carapeguá and is studying for a degree in Accounting. She is determined to become a professional who is useful to society and also to help her family.

Once she finishes her degree, Daisy wants to establish her own accounting practice so that she can serve society with her knowledge. She is requesting this loan so that she can cover her degree expenses, which are outstanding. Daisy appreciates this opportunity she has received so that she can keep growing.

loans.use: to pay her degree fees.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita, 52, is married and has three children, two of whom are still in school. For the past five years she has raised pigs to sell in the Philippines.

Carmelita has taken out and successfully repaid two prior loans through NWTF. She is now applying for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy pig feed and vitamins. She is striving to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Cristie

texts.en:
Cristie is 24 years old, and she is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cristie has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her business.

Cristie has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Elenita works hard to support her family.

She has a business farming vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling sand and gravel. Elenita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies for her vegetable-farming business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items like milk and sugar

loans.name: Samai

texts.en: This is 56-year-old Samai. He is married and has six children ages 33, 31, 29, 19, 11 and 8 years. He has five additional dependents who are his apprentices. In 1985, Samai established his tailoring business. He began his business as an income-generating activity. His business is located in the middle of city and his main customers are neighbors and passersby. He works seven days a week and 16 hours a day. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. He requires a loan in order to buy sewing inputs. He hopes that this loan will help him to develop his shop. He plans to change his business as he gradually approaches old age. In the future, Samai plans to expand his business. His business was expanded due to the more income he receives from his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for sewing inputs

loans.name: Lucila Elvira

texts.es:
Lucila es una mujer casada, comprometida, se esmera mucho en su trabajo, es madre de un pequeño de 10 años y junto con su esposo trabajan duramente para darle una buena calidad de vida, por su parte Lucila aporta en su hogar con su negocio de confección directa, ella fabrica uniformes, blusas, sudaderas, todo por encargo.
Su objetivo con su confección es poder generar empleo, tener muchos pedidos, que la mantenga ocupada siempre trabajando, para poder tener capital con el cual quiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, pagar la educación de su hijo, comprar cosas para el hogar etc.
Esta actividad la empleo también por una incapacidad que la aleja de trabajos pesados.
Lucila solicita formalmente un apoyo financiero para la compra de telas para cubrir unos pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Lucila is a married woman who is committed and puts a great deal of effort into her work. She is a mother of a 10-year-old son. Lucila and her husband work hard to achieve a good quality of life. She contributes to her household through her sewing business. Lucila produces uniforms, blouses, and sweatshirts that have been ordered.

Her goal with her sewing is to create jobs and complete several orders. She is always working and staying busy so that she will have money to improve the condition of her home, pay for her son's education, and buy things for her house. Another reason why Lucila works in this trade is because she has a disability that prevents her from doing heavy work.

She is formally requesting financial support in order to buy fabrics so that she can complete a few outstanding orders.

loans.use: to buy fabrics in order to complete a few outstanding orders.

loans.name: Mario Adalberto

texts.es: Mario de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica desde hace 15 años a la albañilería y también posee una tienda, y con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Mario quiere mejorar su casa terminando de construir el cuarto que muestra en la fotografía pero como no posee de suficiente capital para realizarlo, está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ladrillos, laminas, cemento, arena, polines, etc. para que el y su familia puedan vivir más cómodos.
texts.en:
Mario is 58 years of age and lives in his own house with his wife and two children.  He's been working as a stonemason for 15 years and also has a store.  With the sales he's able to cover some of the home expenses.  
Mario wants to improve his house by finishing to build the room shown in the picture but he doesn't have the money to do it.  With that goal he's requesting a loan to buy bricks, sheets, cement, beams, and sand enabling him and his family to live more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sheets, cement, beams, and sand.

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama San Expedito de la Ciudad de Itá está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder ir superando su situación de pobreza.
A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo una de las que se esfuerzan cada día es la Sra. María, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas variadas que ella misma hace, y que luego sale a vender de manera ambulante, ella es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, es por ello que tiene una muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella las ricas comidas que hace.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de carne, condimentos, verduras, pollo, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con la elaboración de sus comidas como lo viene haciendo y deleitando a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group named San Expedito from the city of  Itá is in the poverty elimination program, in which one puts her best effort into being able to overcome her poverty situation.

Through continuous hard work and effort, one of the ones who strives every day is María. She sells various foods. She makes it herself ad then goes out to sell as a street vendor. She is a woman who is very good at what she does. That is why she has a good clientele that always buys the delicious meals she makes from her. 

She is asking for this loan to buy meant, seasonings, vegetables, chicken and more so she can continue making her food as she has been doing, delighting her customers.

loans.use: to buy meat, seasonings, vegetables, chicken and more.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is a 52-year-old married man and a father of four grown children, and he is from Leyte, Philippines. Edgar has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than five years now. This is the source of his income. 

Edgar is requesting to take a loan to buy more piglets and animal feed. A loan will help him in improving his business, as well as his income. 

Edgar hopes of making his business more profitable and stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and animal feed.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira works hard to support her family. She is married and has a candle-making business in the Philippines.

Elvira requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials such as cord, wax, etc. for her business.

Elvira has been in this business for ten years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Elvira would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials such as cord, wax, etc. for her candle-making business.

loans.name: Evelita

texts.en:
Evelita is 54 years old and married with four children.

Evelita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evelita has been in pig fattening for ten years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Evelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nen

texts.en:
Nen, 33, lives in a small community in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. He is father of two little children. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business; he primarily grows rice and sells his agricultural products to the local dealers. So far, he has been in this type of business for eight years. On average, he is able to make an income of USD 7.00 a day.

He wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL, which has a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 34 years old and married.

She earns a living by farming vegetables and root crops in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Evelyn has been farming vegetable and root crops for 20 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Florita is 45 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Florita has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Florita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like abaca fiber, etc. for her business.

Florita has been in this business for 8 years. Florita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like abaca fiber, etc. for her business

loans.name: Melfil

texts.en:
Melfil is 30 years old and single.

Melfil is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her chickens.

Melfil has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melfil would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her chickens.

loans.name: Nilfreda

texts.en:
Nilfreda is 58 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nilfreda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, candies, biscuits, juice, cereals, etc.

Nilfreda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Orostesa

texts.en:
Orostesa is 54 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Orostesa is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Orostesa has been involved in pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from selling sand and gravel.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en: Ramona, 56 years old, is married and has one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 20 years, Ramona has operated an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials such as abaca fiber, etc. for her business. In the future, Ramona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials such as abaca fiber, etc. for her business

loans.name: Jocelou

texts.en:
Jocelou is 30 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jocelou has a general store business in the Philippines. Jocelou requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of items to sell in her general store.

Jocelou has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Jocelou would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 58 years old and married with four children.

Juana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like biscuits, sugar, coffee, detergent, soap, soft drinks, beers, etc. to sell.

Juana has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Juana aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like biscuits, sugar, coffee, detergent, soap, soft drinks, beers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Leonila works hard to support her family.

She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fruit vending. Leonila is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her abaca weaving business.

Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 72 years old and married with four children. 

Leonila is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Leonila requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Leonila has been involved in pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leonila would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rhea Mae

texts.en: Rhea Mae is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 5 years, Rhea Mae has operated an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her weaving business. In the future, Rhea Mae would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bamboo stick vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns additional income from pig fattening. Rosalina is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional bamboo for her business.

Rosalina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional bamboo for her business

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is 56 years old, married and she is a vendor selling vegetables and grocery items at the market. She has grown-up children but she doesn't want to rely on their remittances, so she opened a store to gain income.

She is now asking for additional capital to invest in her business. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy vegetables, canned goods, sugar, milk and noodles to sell.

Someday, she hopes to acquire more profits for the improvement of her business. She will pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, canned goods, sugar, milk and noodles to sell

loans.name: Chamnan

texts.en:
Chamnan is a 20-year-old single freshman from Prey Veng province, Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in English literature, at a university in the city. His parents are farmers who also earn some income from making different types of sweet snack foods to sell at the market. 

Chamnan is requesting a loan because he needs finances to pay his university fees from the first to the fourth year. The loan will enable him to earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. For his future dreams, Chamnan hopes to have a good job with a reasonable salary so he will be able to save money to run a business and renovate his house.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Olympia

texts.en:
Olympia works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Olympia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her weaving business.

Olympia has been in this business for 10 years now.

Olympia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes works hard to support her family. She is married and has a firewood and charcoal vending business in the Philippines.

Mercedes requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of firewood and charcoal to sell.

Mercedes has been in this business for five years now.

Mercedes would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of firewood and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is 58 years old and married with six children. Sherlita works very hard to provide for them.

Sherlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Sherlita has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, milk, juice, coffee, detergent, soap, fabric conditioners, etc. 

In the future, Sherlita would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 43 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Vilma is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Vilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 49 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Wilfreda has a buy-and-sell coconut shell business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of coconut shells to sell.

Wilfreda has been in this business for four years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of coconut shells to sell

loans.name: Fredeswinda

texts.en:
Fredeswinda is 68 years old and widowed with ten children.

Fredeswinda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Fredeswinda has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Fredeswinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 42 years old and a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Loreta has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Loreta has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Armie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Armie works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable and fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Armie is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers for her vegetable and fruit vending business.

Armie has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en: Rosalyn, 30 years old, is married and has three children, two of them currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 10 years, Rosalyn  has operated an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business. In the future, Rosalyn would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and earns additional income from pig fattening. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store.  

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina, 62 years old, is married and has one child. Catalina works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 5 years, Catalina has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as breads, eggs, sanitary pads, cereals, coffee, juice, etc. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more of these items. Catalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items such as bread, eggs, sanitary pads, cereals, coffee, juice, etc. to sell

loans.name: Loramie

texts.en:
Loramie, 37 years old, is married and has one child in school. Loramie works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for six years and also earns an income from selling feeds and rice. 

Loramie has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell. Loramie has previously borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Consolacion works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Consolacion is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Consolacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Muazzama

texts.ru: Муаззама женщина 30 лет, замужем, молодая мать троих детей. Она закончила школу и вышла замуж. Молодой семье было сложно, поэтому Муаззама решила начать свой бизнес и помогать мужу. На сбереженные деньги она купила 2 барана и начала за ними ухаживать. И сейчас спустя 10 лет у нее на участке земли 10 баранов и две коровы. Муаззама также выращивает овощи и продает на рынке. Она хочет увеличить поголовье своего скота, купить молодых барашков, поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Она и раньше пользовалась нашими услугами, которые ей очень помогли и в жизни, и в  бизнесе .Муаззама, как постоянный клиент, надеется на положительный ответ со стороны МДО Арванд. Благодарит за доверие и поддержку.
texts.en: Muazzama is a 30-year old woman, married and the mother of three. She got married after finishing secondary school. The young family did not have it easy, and so Muazzama decided to launch her own business and help her husband. She used her savings to buy two sheep and started fattening them. Now, 10 years later, she has 10 sheep and two cows on her land plot. Muazzama also grows vegetables and sells them at the market. She would like to increase her livestock and buy young sheep, which is why she has reached out to the Arvand microfinance institution for financial support. She used  [Arvand's] financial services before, and found them to be of great help in her life and business. Muazzama, as a long-time customer, hopes to receive a positive decision from Arvand. She thanks you for your trust and support.

loans.use: to expand the size of  livestock.

loans.name: Tevi's Group

texts.en: Tevi’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Tevi makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a construction worker and craft maker to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ferney

texts.es:
Ferney es un hombre de 47 años de edad es padre responsable de un hogar conformado por su esposa y dos hijos de 15 y 10 años de edad que inicio hace ya varios años un negocio de monta llantas, negocio que le dedica 10 horas de cada día de la semana, la razón de porque trabaja tanto es que es el único que genera ingresos en su hogar, quiere pagar la educación de sus hijos, quiere mejorar las condiciones de su vida, quiere que su negocio crezca sueña con tener un carro, con tener una vivienda propia. 
Ferney sigue trabajando muy duro, ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de neumáticos, grasas, parches, le salen más económico comprarlas en cantidades, sacando más utilidades.
texts.en:
Ferney is a 47 year old man. He is a responsible family man. His family is made up of his wife and their two children, aged 15 and 10. Several years ago, he opened his tire shop. He works at this business 10 hours a day every day of the week. The reason he works so hard is that he is his family's only source of income. He wants to pay for his children's education, improve his standard of living, and he wants his business to grow and he dreams of having a car and owning his own home. 
 
Ferney continues to work very hard. Now he is asking for a loan to buy tires, grease, and patches. It is more economical for him to buy in quantities, and he makes more profits.

loans.use: to buy tires, grease, and patches for his tire shop.

loans.name: Kunthy's Group

texts.en: Kunthy’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Kunthy makes a living cultivating rice. There is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water in their village. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Cheoun's Group

texts.en: Cheoun’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Cheoun makes a living cultivating rice. There is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water in their village. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Thourn's Group

texts.en: Thourn’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Thourn makes a living cultivating rice. There is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water in their village. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: San Jorge 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres San Jorge II está en su ciclo número 2 Del programa de comité de mujeres, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una desea conocer su situación de vida, y conforme a su esfuerzo y con las capacitaciones ir mejorando cada día.
Una persona que se destaca es la Sra. Lidia, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir, está en un nivel medio de pobreza, donde la Sra. Lidia a través de las ventas de ropas que hace, trata de ir mejorando cada día su situación de pobreza para poder ayudar a su familia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que está luchando para poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo ya que necesita poder comprar prendas nuevas, de manera a poder continuar con sus ventas, luchando por ir mejorando su situación de la pobreza. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en: The Group "Mujeres San Jorge II" is in its second cycle of the Women's Committee. They form part of the program of poverty elimination, where each one wants to learn about her life's condition, and according to each person's effort and training, progress day by day. Lidia is one of these women, who in her latest poll showed a poverty level of two, which means a medium level of poverty. Through the sale of clothes, Lidia is trying to improve everyday her poverty situation in order to help her family. She is a very hardworking person who is struggling to move ahead and help her loved ones. She is requesting this loan because she needs to buy new items, and in this way continue with her sales, working hard to improve her poverty situation. She is grateful for the opportunity she gets to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy different clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en:
Efrena is 47 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living with a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Efrena is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Efrena has been in pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from weaving.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is 60 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Caridad is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Caridad has been in pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from weaving.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell-books business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more books to sell to her customers.

Estrella has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from food vending.

Estrella has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more books to sell to her customers

loans.name: Charie

texts.en:
Charie is 32 years old and married with one child in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Charie has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of clothing to sell.

Charie has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Charie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 62 years old and married with seven children.

Flora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Flora has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Flora aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 59 years old and married with six children.

Elizabeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Elizabeth has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Elizabeth aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 43 years old and married with four children. With four children currently in school, Herminia works very hard to provide for them.

Herminia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like snack foods, biscuits, candies, juice, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Herminia has been in this business for 29 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, biscuits, candies, juice, soft drinks, etc. and earns additional income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Herminia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like snack foods, biscuits, candies, juice, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.ru: Озода женщина 27 лет, замужем, молодая мать троих детей. После окончания 9 классов средней школы Озода вышла замуж и переехала в деревню к своему мужу. Её муж работал шофером, денег не хватало на большую семью, поэтому Озода решила помочь своему мужу и занялась животноводством и земледелием. На своем участке земли Озода пасёт одну корову и двух барашек и выращивает овощи и фрукты. Весь товар Озода сама собирает и относит на рынок для продажи. В настоящее время  Озода планирует расширить свой бизнес, закупить новые семена для посадки и купить корм для скота. Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Озода заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Ozoda is a 27-year old woman, married and the mother of three. After finishing the ninth grade of secondary school, Ozoda got married and moved to her husband's village. Her husband used to work as a driver; his income was not enough for their large family, and so Ozoda decided to help her husband and started growing livestock and growing farm crops. Ozoda tends to one cow and two sheep and also grows vegetables and fruits on her land plot. Ozoda harvests her produce herself and brings it to the market to sell. At present Ozoda plans to expand her business, buy new seeds for the planting season as well as animal feed. This is why she has reached out to the Arvand microfinance institution for support. Ozoda thanks you in advance for your trust and support.

loans.use: to improve her garden soil.

loans.name: Jorge Andres

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven de admirar muy talentoso para el estudio, preocupado por su familia este muchacho de 19 años de edad con trabajo duro, aceptando hacer trabajos de mucho esfuerzo junto ahorros para iniciar un negocio de servicios de videojuegos, inicio con una sola máquina que pueden ver en la foto para a partir de trabajo ha ido comprando más maquinaria. 
Jorge quiere ser el soporte para su familia, para su abuela, para sus hermanos, para sus padres, pagarse los estudios, ser un profesional y llevar su familia a un mejor estilo de vida.
Jorge solicita un préstamo para la compra de un televisor de 32 pulgadas lcd y una consola play 4, para darles a sus clientes un buen entretenimiento.
texts.en:
Jorge is a young man to be admired for his talents in his studies. Out of concern for his family, and with hard work, this young man of 19 years old agreed to work, and with great effort he saved money to start a video game service business. He started with only one console, which you can see in the photo, and since then he has gone along buying more consoles.

Jorge wants to be the support for his family; for his grandma, his siblings, his parents. He also wants to pay for his schooling, to be a professional and to bring his family to a better style of life. Jorge is requesting a loan to buy a 32 inch LCD TV, and a Playstation 4 console in order to provide his customers good entertainment.

loans.use: to buy a 32 inch LCD TV, and a Playstation 4.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 49 years old and a married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jocelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish and other seafood to sell in her food stall.

Jocelyn has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other seafood to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamin es un hombre solitario vive su vida prácticamente en su hogar, en este adecuo un pequeño espacio para ejercer su actividad de cría de ganado porcino, para la cual interactuar jugara un papel muy importante, debido a las asesorías que le brinda y a que lo apoyara en un préstamo legal pues antes tenía que recurrir con fuentes no legales que le cobraban intereses altísimos.
Con la ayuda del préstamo comprara una cerda de cría, 5 lechones y su respectivo alimento.
El sueña con tener una granja de varias hectáreas de solo cerdos.
texts.en:
Benjamin is a solitary man. He lives his life practically in his his home, where he has set up a small space to carry out his activity of raising pigs. For this,  Interactuar will play a very big role, because of the counseling it offers and the help it will give him with a legal loan. Previously, he had to resort to illegal sources that charged very high interests.  

With the help of the loan, he will buy a sow, 5 piglets and their respective feed. He dreams of having a farm just for pigs with several hectares.

loans.use: to buy a sow, 5 piglets and their feed.

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona is 26 years old and single.

Ma. Chona earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Ma. Chona has been in pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from weaving.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is 61 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Demetria has been in this business for 21 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sanitary pads, bath soap, toothpaste, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Demetria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more household products

loans.name: Jose Erney

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 32 años de edad, muy trabajador, hábil, cariñoso y honrado, él tiene una cafetería donde oferta pues valga la redundancia café, bebidas, comidas, pero su idea es llevar su negocio a otro nivel, tratar de abarcar más productos para que su tienda genere más ganancias.
Para llevar su negocio al siguiente nivel necesita de su apoyo, un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de abarrotes, vivieres haciendo de su cafetería una tienda general pero más interactiva, donde los clientes pueden ir a observar los productos algo como un supermercado pero a menor escala. 
Su sueño es algún día abrir su primer supermercado y generar los recursos para que su pareja y su hija de 8 años de edad no pasen necesidades.
texts.en:
José is a 32 year old man. He is very hard-working, capable, affectionate, and honest. He has a café where he sells coffee, other beverages, and food, but his idea is to take his business to the next level. He will try to include more products so his store generates greater profits.

In order to take his business to the next level, he needs your help. He will invest the loan in the purchase of groceries and supplies, turning his café into a general store, but a more interactive one where clients can go to see the products – like a supermarket, but on a smaller scale.

His dream is to one day open his first supermarket and generate more income so that his partner and his eight-year-old daughter do not suffer hardships.

loans.use: to buy groceries and supplies in order to add staple household products to his coffee shop

loans.name: Liliana Cristina

texts.es:
Liliana es una mujer muy luchadora, que no se rinda y persevera para alcanzar sus metas ella tiene 26 años de edad, un hijo de 6 y es separa de su marido, como tal genera ingresos con la venta de alimentos, pero estos los hacía en su casa, con un enorme esfuerzo consiguió un local pero le falta surtirlo con activos fijos es por ellos que solicita un préstamo para la compra de una nevera, una licuadora, plancha y surtido de alimentos como frutas y fritos, ella quiere demostrar que tiene todas las capacidades para mantener a sus hijos.
Su mayor sueño es comprar una vivienda, tener un restaurante y que su hijo cuando crezca asista a la universidad y se gradué.
texts.en:
Liliana is a very determined woman who does not give up and who perseveres until she reaches her goals. She is 26 years old. She has a six-year-old child and she is separated from her husband. She generates income by selling food. She makes the food at home. With a lot of effort, she managed to obtain other premises, but she is not able to furnish it with fixed assets. For these reasons, she is requesting a loan in order to buy a refrigerator, a blender, a grill, and food supplies. She wants to show that she has the ability to look after her children.

Her greatest dream is to buy a house, have a restaurant, and have her son graduate from university when he is grown up.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, a blender, a grill, and food supplies for her business

loans.name: Regernesa

texts.en:
Regernesa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like vegetables, rice, spices, fish, meat, etc., for her business.

Regernesa has been in this business for ten years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like vegetables, rice, spices, fish, meat, etc., for her business

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 41 years old and has seven children. She is married and has three children who are currently in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Trinidad has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Trinidad would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Lorena

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ma. Lorena works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and general store.  Ma. Lorena is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc., for her food production business.

Ma. Lorena has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc., for her food production business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 45 years old and widowed with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Marites is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marites has been in pig fattening for ten years and also earns additional income from selling purchase order cards and weaving.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Analu

texts.en:
Analu works hard to support her family. Analu is married and has a selling dry goods business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks like sponges, bags, shorts, blouses, etc. to sell.

Analu has been in this business for seven years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Analu would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like sponges, bags, shorts, blouses, etc. to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 64 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20.000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Virginia has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Analie is 35 years old and has four children who are in school.

She has a rug making business in the Philippines. Analie requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Analie has been in this business for four years. In the future, Analie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Anita has been in this business for 21 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.  Anita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a cosmetics business

loans.name: Ruth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ruth es una dama de 50 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijas de mayores de edad, siempre fui muy casera entregada a su familia a la crianza de sus hijos, a su pareja, ella genera su propio sustento tiene un cultivo de yuca que es el vegetal que sostiene en sus manos, también tiene un criadero de pollos y venta de huevos.
Su actividad la aprendió de su pareja y su idea es ampliar sus cultivos, y lo hará solicitando un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de insumos como abonos, riegos, semillas, compra de pollos.
Este préstamo le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos ya que en el mercado el precio de venta de pollos y yuca está muy desvalorizado y solo le queda aumentar su producción para seguir sobreviviendo en su hogar.
texts.en:
Ruth is a 50-year-old woman. She is the mother of three children, who are all grown up. She was always a homebody: dedicated to her family, to raising her children, and to her partner. She supports herself. She grows cassava, which is the vegetable she is holding in her hand in the photo. She also raises chickens and sells eggs.

She learnt her work from her partner and her plan is to expand her crops. She will do this by requesting a loan, which she will invest in the purchase of supplies, such as compost, irrigation, seeds, and chickens. This loan will enable her to improve her income since the market price for chickens and cassava is very low and she needs to increase her yield in order to continue surviving.

loans.use: to buy compost, irrigation, seeds, and chickens

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Emma has been in this business for seven years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Сайёра 25 летняя женщина из не большого района Чилинкул. Она замужем, но пока детей нет. Сайёра с мужем очень  хотят детей. Сайёра дома занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она принимает клиенток на дому. Сайёре нравиться работать в этой сфере деятельности и надеется, что сможет продолжить свою работу далее. Сейчас ней необходимо купить швейные принадлежности (нитки, иголки, ножницы) без которых она не сможет продолжить работу. Так как ее средств не хватает для совершения покупки, она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: Sayora is 25 years old and she comes from the small district of Jilikul.  She is married but doesn't have any children yet.  She and her husband are looking forward to having children.  Sayora sews women's dresses from home.  Her customers come to visit her in her house.  Sayora enjoys being involved in this sphere of work, and she hopes that she will be able to continue her activity.  At the moment, she needs to buy sewing supplies (threads, needles, scissors) without which she cannot continue her work.  Since Sayora doesn't have enough money for this purchase, she has requested a loan.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Martha Helena

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 35 años de edad que con su actividad de cría de pollos, con esto mantiene su hogar, su madre, sus hermanos, sus abuelos, ella es nacida y criada en el campo y trabaja fuertemente para que familia tenga un plato de comida. 
Su sueño es poder tener un hijo, es algo que le quita el sueño quiere ser madre y darle todo el amor que tiene por dentro.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de pollos, tener otro potrero, y seguir fiel a sus principios de mantener su familia. 
Ella espera que su economía mejore, que sigan comiendo dignamente y que junto con s pareja pueda construir una casa en material.
texts.en:
Martha is a woman of 35 who with her business of raising chickens maintains her household, her mother, her siblings, and her grandparents. She was born and raised in the countryside, and she works hard so that her family can have a plate of food.

Her dream is to be able to have a child. It is something that keeps her awake at night. She wants to be a mother and give her child all the love that she has inside.

She is applying for a loan to purchase chickens, to have another corral, and to stay faithful to her principles of supporting her family.

She hopes that her economy improves, that they continue eating decently, and that along with her partner she can build a house of [quality] material.

loans.use: to buy chickens, to have another corral, and to continue growing every day as a business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start her own clothing business

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is an entrepreneurial 24 year old, who hopes to open a fish business in the Handeni district. Living with her parents, she currently volunteers at a nearby secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide. Through her lessons, Amina encourages students to find their own strengths, and to think about how to create a better world. 

Amina also helps her family in a community project in her village. With a Kiva loan, Amina plans to buy fish in order to launch her fish business in her village. She plans to use any profits she makes to help her family with household expenses. The interest on Amina’s loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: to launch her fish business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  start  a business in clothing

loans.name: Shahnozai

texts.ru: Шахнозаи 22 года. Она проживает на районе Чилинкул. Шахнозаи живет вместе с родителями. Она преподает в школе и любит свою работу. Ей нравиться работать с детьми и помогать им во всем. Шахнозаи обратилась за кредитом, чтобы отремонтировать дом, который давно не ремонтировали и срочно нуждается в ремонте. Шахнозаи хочет, чтоб ее родители жили в безопасном и в уютном доме.
