Maria has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to launch a grocery business

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 47-year-old married woman and mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his rickshaw. 

He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but due to some maintenance issues, he is not able to provide better services to more customers and ultimately earns less profit. 

Therefore, Razia has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband. Her husband will utilize this loan amount to repair his rickshaw. This will help him to provide quality services to his customers and earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Ma. Ceila

texts.en:
Ma. Ceila is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Ceila is 41 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Ma. Ceila has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Ceila requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more packs of food to sell to her customers.

Ma. Ceila has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Ma. Ceila would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 62 years old and married with four children.

Rosa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Rosa has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Rosa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, canned goods, groceries, etc

loans.name: Maricha

texts.en:
Maricha is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maricha is 53 years old, and one child is still in school.

Maricha has a general store business in the Philippines. Maricha requested a 29,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, eggs, biscuits, diapers, seasonings, sanitary pads, bath soap, etc., to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Maricha has been in this business for 21 years. Maricha would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, eggs, biscuits, diapers, seasonings, sanitary pads, bath soap, etc., to sell

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 52 years old and has five children.  She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Maribel is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her chickens.

Maribel has been raising chickens for 10 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Maribel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, a serger and a cover seam machine.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en: Hello Lenders! Meet Celina, 45, a mother of three who has defied the notion among her friends that farming is an old-fashioned way of earning a living. Her primary sources of income are cabbages, milk, eggs and farming. Celina hails from Nkubu, Kenya, an area that enjoys favorable weather patterns that boost crop production in the area. Celina, being someone who is very ambitious and someone who always takes advantage of positive things, would like to capitalize on the good weather patterns experienced in the region and boost her farming. Being a hardworking mother, Celina has always ensured putting food on the table for her family. She also ensures she is able to take her children to school. Celina detests living in conditions of poverty and she has a plan to improve her standard of living. This is why she is seeking a loan of 57,200 KES in order to be able to purchase a dairy cow. This will help in producing milk and manure to be used on her farm. Milk from the cow will be sold to the local market and this means improved cash flow. Through improved cash flow, profits will be higher and she can comfortably take care of her family and take her children to school. Through your loan, Celina will be empowered economically and be able to improve her standard of living and also those of people living within the area. Celina is very comfortable with the repayment plan and the monthly installments.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Jessica Karina

texts.es:
Jessica    es una joven mujer  ecuatoriana de 23 años de edad, quien nación en la ciudad de Latacunga, perteneciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi,  una de las provincias mas reconocidas por su gente trabajadora del país Ecuador, ella actualmente está  casada tiene un  hijo pequeño , ella vive en casa de los padres en casa propia , el obstáculo mas grande que ha tenido fue el tener que trabajar desde muy niña para poder ayudar en su casa por esta razón tuvo que salir a buscar trabajo y ahora es un  gran apoyo para su esposo ya que comparten los gastos.
Hoy en día Jessica  se dedica a la comercialización de legumbres y verduras desde hace mas de cuatro años  esta actividad la aprendió de su hermana con quien tiene a medias este negocio desde ya hace algún tiempo atrás, la actividad mas difícil en este negocio es sin duda r alguna la falta de transporte para el traslado de su producto, ya que  gasta mucho en transporte.
Su sueño y anhelo es poder  tener  un carro y un mejor estilo de vida, para que a futuro no les pueda faltar nada.  Necesita el crédito para la compra de mas producto ya que al tener un pedido muy grande tiene un faltante de producto , Jessica y su familia  quieren  extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Jessica is a young Ecuadorian woman who is 23 years old. She was born in the city of Latacunga, which belongs to the Cotopaxi province, one of the provinces best known for its hard-working people in the country of Ecuador. She is currently married. She has a small son. She lives in the home of her parents. The largest obstacle that she has had is having had a job since she was very young to be able to help her household. For this reason, she had to go out to look for work, and now she is a great support to her husband since they share expenses.

Nowadays, Jessica has made a living from selling legumes and vegetables for more than four years. She learned this activity from her sister, with whom she has shared this business since some time ago. The most difficult activity in this business is without a doubt the lack of transportation for the transport of her product, since she spends a lot on transportation.

Her dream and desire is to be able to have a car and a better lifestyle, because of which in the future they lack nothing. She needs the loan to purchase more products since because of having a very large order she has a lack of products. Jessica and her family want to extend a sincere thank

loans.use: to purchase more product and continue growing the business; her long-term dream is to have a car to transport merchandise.

loans.name: Wendy Melissa

texts.es: Wendy, tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene a su cargo dos hijos con quienes vive en un sector de San Pedro Sula, Cortes. En busca de obtener ingresos ha logrado iniciar desde hace 8 meses su propio negocio de pulpería para vender granos básicos, azúcar, café, pan, condimentos, churros, dulces, embutidos, refrescos y otros abarrotes. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 5,000 lempiras para surtir más el negocio con variedad de productos y mejorar las ventas ya que del negocio cubre los gastos de alimentación y educación para sus hijos. Va comprar granos básicos, lácteos, refrescos, churros, azúcar, y productos de aseo. Su plan es mantener siempre su negocio y hacerlo crecer para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Wendy is 24 years old. She is a single mother who has two children in her care, with whom she lives in a sector of San Pedro Sula, Cortes. In search of making an income she was able to open her own grocery store 8 months ago in order to sell basic grains, sugar, coffee, bread, condiments, churros, sweets, lunchmeat, soft drinks, and other groceries. 

She has requested a loan for 5,000 lempiras to supply her business more with a variety of products and to improve her sales since the business covers her children’s food and educational expenses. She is going to purchase basic grains, milk products, soft drinks, churros, sugar, and cleaning products. Her plan is to always maintain her business and make it grow in order to come out ahead with her family.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, milk products, soft drinks, churros, sugar, and cleaning products to sell.

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.en: Mariyam  is a 49-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. Mariyam  is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase good quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina is a 24-year-old cosmetics vendor, volunteer teacher and mother, living in the Iringa District. As a Camfed Learner Guide, Christina volunteers to teach life skills in her nearby secondary school. Her lessons focus on effective communication and on building her students’ confidence. Christina also inspires her students by running her own cosmetics store. When business is good, Christina is able to support her younger brother and sister, who are both dependent on her. She is now requesting a Kiva loan in order to increase her stock of cosmetics and to cover her own household expenses. The interest on Christina’s loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: to increase her stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a women’s clothing business.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a 20-year-old girl. She is not married and has no children. She spends 2.5 hours every week to give education on life skills to secondary school students who are in her area. 

She is requesting a Kiva loan to use as capital to open a grocery shop because no one is running such a shop in the village. 

The profit from the shop will help her to facilitate her homestead requirements for herself and her relatives who depend on her for school requirements such as school stationery, e.g., pens, pencils, exercise books and uniforms. She aspires to undertake a teaching course for the next two years.

loans.use: to open a grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by buying sufficient stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her business.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 52-year-old, vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. 

Shameem’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of three children. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time to gain more profits for fulfilling her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Это  женщина Мунира. Она проживает в районе Вахш вместе семьей. Ей 36 лет. У нее трое детей. Мунира занимается выращиванием малый рогатого скота. Она продвигает эту деятельность уже 2 года. У нее ест коровник, где она выращивает мелко рогатых скотов. Ей в работе помогает муж. У Мунире очень старается увеличить поголовье скота, расширить деятельность и увеличить доход. Но так как у нее не хватает денежных средств на покупку скотин, Мунира обратилась за кредитом. Мунира верит в Вас и то, что Вы сможете ей помочь
texts.en:
This woman is Munira.  She lives in the Vakhsh region of Tajikistan together with her family.  She's 36, and has three children.  She raises small, 4-legged livestock for a living, and has plied this trade for 2 years already.  She has a shed to raise her livestock in, and her husband helps her tend to their animals.  
Munira is trying very hard to increase her livestock headcount, as well as expand her business and increase her income.  But seeing as she lacks the money to buy livestock, Munira has requested a loan.  Munira believes in you and your ability to help her.

loans.use: buy small, 4-legged livestock

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 59 years old and married with eight children. Violeta works very hard to provide for them.

Violeta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Violeta has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as beverages, canned goods, biscuits, coffee, candies and other groceries. 

In the future, Violeta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio, tiene 38 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una aldea de Nueva Frontera Santa Bárbara. Antes cultivaba chile, maracuyá, frijol y maíz, y hace 11 años ha cultivado café, este cultivo le genera mayor ingreso para la familia. La producción la vende en la misma zona. Esta solicitando el segundo préstamo y es por 20,000 lempiras para comprar abonos e insumos para fertilizar y limpiar su finca de café. Con esta inversión  va mantener en buen estado el cultivo. Su meta es seguir cultivando café para mantener su fuente de ingresos y darle mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Antonio is 38 years old, married and have 3 children. He lives in a village of Nueva Frontera Santa Bárbara.  He used to grow peppers, passion fruit, bean and corn and for 11 years now, he grows coffee. This crop is the one that generates more revenue for the family. He sells his production in the same area.

He is requesting a second loan of 20,000 lempiras to buy fertilizers and supplies to fertilize and clean his coffee plantation.  With this investment he can maintain his crop in good condition.  His goal is to continue to grow coffee to maintain his revenue source and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies to fertilize and clean his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran is a 59-year-old married woman who has been successfully running a shop-keeping business for three years. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Bashiran needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. 

Bashiran has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to launch herself as a clothing vendor

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana  is 48 years old, a married lady, and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. 

Rukhsana  makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of 55,000 PKR which she will use  to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

Rukhsana  wishes to utilize part of her revenues in providing a good quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 36 years old. She is a married woman and a mother of seven children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing the services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy stitching materials such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, etc., to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching materials such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, etc., to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Siwema

texts.en:
Siwema is a hard-working market-store owner and volunteer teacher. As a Camfed Learner Guide, Siwema is giving back in her ward secondary school by helping children to pursue their education. Her lessons encourage students to tackle their life challenges — such as self-confidence and strong communication — so that they can perform well in their studies. 

Siwema has a market store at her home which she is running profitably. Nonetheless, Siwema is challenged by not having a store-frame from which to do business. Siwema is therefore requesting a Kiva loan in order to renovate her frame, as well as to buy more stock in fish, flour and rice in order to expand her business. 

Siewma’s vision is to run a large and thriving store, and to support her family’s essential home needs. The interest on Siwema’s loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: to renovate her store frame

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es una mujer de 32 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijas de 10 y 4 años, y su negocio es el tejido de mantas de vicuña.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘alto chijini’ un valle alto, completamente verde, con muchos ríos y el verde cubriendo su suelo. De esta característica nace el nombre Aymará de chijini, que traducido al español significa pasto, lugar donde pastaban las llamas. Era una zona de mucha producción y donde se disponía de aguas cristalinas por efecto de numerosos ríos que atravesaban el lugar. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 7 y 13 grados centígrados.
Vilma es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. su negocio es el tejido de mantas con lana de vicuña, actividad que inició por iniciativa familiar, anteriormente trenzaba mantas para otras personas, luego se independizó y empezó a generar mejores ingresos. Su anterior trabajo la dejó con una lista de clientes fijos y ella menciona que su ventaja es la de trabajar en casa y poder ocuparse del cuidado de sus hijas. “mi trabajo tiene mucha demanda porque las mantas de vicuña son muy tradicionales y el precio me genera buenos ingresos…” comenta. Su sueño es ampliar y expandir su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de lana de vicuña por mayor para contar con material de trabajo constante. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Vilma solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana de vicuña para trabajar constantemente y cuidar a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Vilma is 32 years old and lives with her partner. She has two daughters 10 and 4 years old. Her business is sewing blankets from vicuña wool. She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, responsible and hard-working.

Her business takes place in an area called 'Alto Chijini’ a high valley, completely green,with many rivers and a green ground cover. The Aymara name of chijini comes from this characteristic which translated to Spanish means grass, a place where llamas are pastured. It is a n area of high production and has abundant clear water due to the numerous rivers that flow through the area. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 7 and 13 degrees Celsius.

Vilma is dark-skinned, with long black hair she toes up, dark eyes short in stature and is thin. Her native language is Aymara and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her work.

Her business is weaving blankets from vicuña wool, a business she started through her family. before she used to braid blankets for other people. Then she went independent and began to generate greater income. Her previous work left her with a list of regular clients and she mentions that her advantage is that she works at home and can take care of her children. "My work is in much demand since vicuña wool blankets are very traditional and the price brings me good income," she commented.

Her dream is to expand and grow her business. she wants to make the purchase of vicuña wool to have material to work consistently. This is her first loan with the institution in the 3 years she has been doing this business. for these reasons she is requesting a loan to buy vicuña wool to be bale to work constantly and take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy vicuña wool to keep working and care for her children.

loans.name: Melian

texts.en:
Melian works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Melian requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials and tools for her business.

Melian has been in this business for 27 years now.

Melian would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials and tools for her business

loans.name: Merceditha

texts.en:
Merceditha works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Merceditha requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Merceditha has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Merceditha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 40 years old and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She is married. 

Alma is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Alma requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Alma has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy many more T-shirts to sell from her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  expand her business by purchasing more stock in women’s and children’s clothes

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is an entrepreneurial 28-year-old, living with her parents in the Pangani district and volunteering as a teacher. As a Camfed Learner Guide, Fatuma helps students with life-skills and self-awareness coaching, in order to improve their performance. 

Fatuma is now requesting a Kiva loan to develop her poultry business, which she runs near her village. Fatuma plans to use her profits in order to begin selling her chickens to a wholesaler. She also has more ambitious business goals in mind, and believes that a Kiva loan will transform her quality of life. The interest on this loan will be repaid through Fatuma’s weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: to develop her poultry business

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 20-year-old volunteer teacher who lives with her parents. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills to students as a means of giving back to her community. Through her lessons, Asia encourages students to find their own strengths, and to think about how to create a better world. 

As she currently doesn't have a business, Asia is now requesting a Kiva loan in order to open a fruit store where she can sell tropical fruits. The profits earned will cover her household expenses and expand her business further.

loans.use: to open a fruit store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes

loans.name: Merylotis

texts.en:
Merylotis is 40 years old and separated with two children. With both children currently in school, Merylotis works very hard to provide for them.

Merylotis runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items, such as shampoo, soft drinks, sugar, vinegar, canned goods, beer, cooking oil, etc., to sell.

Merylotis has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soft drinks, sugar, vinegar, canned goods, beer, cooking oil, etc.

In the future, Merylotis would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items, such as shampoo, soft drinks, sugar, vinegar, canned goods, beer, cooking oil, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita, 52, is a married woman with six children, three of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Pacita has a buy and sell coconut fruit business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Pacita requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more coconut fruits to sell.

In the future, Pacita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more coconut fruits to sell.

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
Almira is 40 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Almira works very hard to provide for them.

Almira runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, cigarettes, beverages, groceries, etc.

Almira has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Almira would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, cigarettes, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 54 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Patricia has a sewing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials such as fabric, thread, needles, etc. for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Patricia has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials such as fabric, thread, needles, etc. for her sewing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start her own grocery business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cristina is 63 years old.

Cristina has a vegetable farming business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years. Cristina requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: Gregorio, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su madre y abuela en una aldea de Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara.  El ha ayudado a su familia en los cultivos de maíz y frijol y hace 3 años tiene su propio cultivo de café, este producto se vende en la misma zona o a intermediarios y espera una buena cosecha. Esta solicitando un préstamo  de 20,000 Lempira para compra de abono y limpieza del mismo y poder lograr buena cosecha. Su sueño es seguir creciendo como agricultor y cultivar más café.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 21 years old, single, and lives with his mother and grandmother in a small village in Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. He has helped his family with the cultivation of corn and beans. For the past three years, he has also had his own coffee crops. He sells his products in the same zone or to intermediaries and he expects a good harvest.

He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Lempiras, which he will use to purchase fertilizer and clean his coffee farm so that he can have a good harvest. His dream is to continue growing as a farmer and to produce more coffee.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and clean his coffee farm.

loans.name: Nazeer

texts.en:
Nazeer is a 45-year-old married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.

Nazeer ’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures.

Therefore, Nazeer has requested 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy children's outfits

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old, and five of her children are currently in school.

Remedios has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell to her customers.

Remedios has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 41 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Anecita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as coffee, canned goods, condiments, etc.

Anecita has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Anecita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as coffee, canned goods, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosa is 46 years old, and two of her children are currently in school.

Rosa has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosa has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Greenly

texts.en:
Greenly is 36 years old and married with one child in school. Greenly works very hard to provide for them.

Greenly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc. Greenly has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Greenly would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Liza works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling coconut wine in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from retailing firewood. Liza is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy coconut wine to sell for her business.

Liza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia works hard to support her family. Rosalia is married and has a business selling coconut fruit in the Philippines.

Rosalia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more coconuts to sell to her customers.

Rosalia has been in this business for 21 years.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosalia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconut fruits to sell to her customers

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 62 years old and married with seven children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,500 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Teresita has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Teresita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rhoda is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rhoda has a salon business in the Philippines. Rhoda requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like nail cutters, etc.

Rhoda has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Rhoda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy needed materials like nail cutters, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new engine for his rickshaw.

loans.name: Sonia Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Sonia sigue adelante con su actividad de realizar tortillas y una pequeña pulpería, como madre responsable de los ingresos ayuda sus hijos a salir adelante, se ha venido apoyando con la ayuda de financiamientos, solicita ahora un nuevo crédito para invertir en el negocio, esta vez comprara maíz para las tortillas, queso, granos básicos, refrescos entre otros esperando mejorar las ventas con esta inversión, la meta de Sonia es darle los estudios a sus hijos y poner un nuevo puesto de tortillas para generar mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Sonia continues with her business making tortillas and selling groceries. As a responsible mother, she uses her income to help her children move forward. She has been supporting her business with the assistance of loans. She now requests another loan to invest in her business. This time, she will purchase corn for the tortillas, cheese, staple grains, beverages, and other things. She hopes to increase her sales with this investment.

Sonia's goals are to provide her children with an education and to open a new tortilla stand in order to generate more income.

loans.use: to continue to invest in her small grocery store business in order to earn an income and help her family.

loans.name: Cjfdt 41 Group

texts.fr: SEYNABOU est une femme très brave qui évolue dans la culture maraîchère. Elle est la présidente du sous groupe CJFDT 41 qui est affilié à la Convergence des Jeunes et Femmes pour le Développement de Tassette. Il est composé de 08 personnes dont 6 femmes et 02 hommes qui habitent tous dans le même village de Tassette et qui pratique les activités de maraîchage. SEYNABOU est reconnu sur la photo par la main levée. Elle est mariée et mère de famille, elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter des semences d'oignons, de pomme de terre et de l'aubergine ainsi que tous les intrants qui peuvent servir pour le développement de son maraîchage. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans et commence sa journée à 7h pour la terminer à 19h. A l'avenir elle souhaite avoir une ferme agricole pour pouvoir augmenter et diversifier ses produits. Ainsi elle pourra exporter ses produits vers la sous région et augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Seynabou is a very serious woman who has been doing market gardening. She is the president of the sub-group  CJFDT 41 which is affiliated to the Gathering of Young People and Women for the Development of Tassette. The sub-group is made up of eight persons, six women and two men, who all live in the village of Tassette and all do market gardening. 

Seynabou can be recognized in the photo because she is raising her hand. She is married and the mother of a family and she is requesting this loan to buy seeds for onions, potatoes, and eggplant, as well as inputs to make her market garden grow well. She has more than five years' experience and begins her workday at 7 am to end it at 7 pm. 

In future, she hopes to have an agricultural farm so as to grow and diversify her produce. In that way, she would be able to export her produce to the surrounding region and grow her income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. Wilma is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Wilma requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store. Wilma has been in this business for 11 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Wilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 59 years old and has five children. Rosita is married and two of her children are still in school.

Rosita is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Rosita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business.

Rosita has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF five times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Maria Liza

texts.en:
Maria Liza is 41 years old and has four children. Maria Liza is married, and three of her children are in school.

Maria Liza is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Maria Liza requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria Liza has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maria Liza would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosita is 39 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rosita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rosita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish, ice, and plastic bags. Rosita has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish, ice, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Lotlot

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lotlot works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling nipa (palm) in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling coconut wine. Lotlot is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy nipa to sell for her nipa business.

Lotlot has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy nipa to sell

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a 25-year-old married man from the city of Dier Al-Balah. He lives with his wife and one small daughter in a small house. Three months ago, Ismail started his own business, which is transferring goods using his rickshaw. It is a good business and supports the family with a good income.

Ismail took a USD murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the remaining cost of his new rickshaw. This will help Ismail to pay part of his urgent expenses.

Ismail appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the remaining cost of his new rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the remaining cost of his new rickshaw.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 30-year-old, married man from Deir Al-Balah city. He is a father of two sons. 

Six months ago, Ahmad started his own business which is transferring goods using his rickshaw. It is a good business and it supports the family with a good income.

Ahmad took a USD Murabaha loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to pay the remaining cost of his new rickshaw. This will help Ahmad to pay part of his urgent expenses.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the remaining cost of his new rickshaw.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 42 years old and a resident of Mitimos, Rizal, Philippines. She has three kids and is a single parent. She owns a sari-sari store (a small grocery store) that forms part of her house, and her neighbors are her clients. 

Since she is a single parent, Lina has decided to improve their small business to better support her children. For this reason, she requested a loan at Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Aside from the financial assistance, she also received add-on benefits like insurance and savings, among others. She hopes that with Paglaum's help, she will become a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia, 48 years old, is married with three kids and is a resident of Libertad, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. Fruits vending is her primary source of income. She has been in this business for eight years. She became a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in June 2013. 

Recently, Aurelia decided to apply for a loan to buy additional fruit for her fruit vending business. She hopes to increase her income by having more inventory to sell. In the future, she hopes to save more for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of bananas

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is 55 years old and lives in Liloy - La Libertad, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is married with four children.

Antonina has a furniture shop, making and selling various furniture items. It also offers services like wood carving and molding. She has had this business for years.

She requested a loan to purchase more inventory of wood to produce more varieties of furniture.

Antonina has been a member of PMPC for 8 years now. In the future, Antonina hopes to own a furniture showroom to attract more customers.

loans.use: to  purchase more inventory of wood to produce more varieties of furniture.

loans.name: Teodula

texts.en:
Teodula works hard to support her family. Teodula is married and has a business selling sand and gravel in the Philippines.

Teodula requested a PHP 21,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional tons of sand and gravel and to pay laborers' wages.

Teodula has been in this business for 12 years.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Teodula would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional tons of sand and gravel and to pay laborers

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Paulina works hard to support her family.

She has a native crafts business in the Philippines, and also earns income from raising pigs. Paulina is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy materials like bamboo, nylon, and other inputs for her native crafts business.

Paulina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like bamboo, nylon, and other inputs for her native crafts

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 54 years old and has one child in school.

Elizabeth has a nipa (palm) roofing business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed .

Elizabeth has been in this business for 35 years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy needed roofing materials

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Donna is 42 years old, and her four children are all in school.

Donna has a business buying and selling nipa in the Philippines. Donna requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional nipa to sell.

Donna has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Donna would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional nipa to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.es: Hace 5 años, Gina, quien habita con su cónyuge y 5 hijos en las edades de 11 a 17 años de edad, decidió emprender una actividad comercial, para genera ingresos y apoyar la gestión de bienestar de su cónyuge. Ella inició vendiendo productos  mediante catálogos, o guías especializadas de artículos varios y poco a poco fue creciendo, agregándole a su oferta, los artículos que su clientela requería , a la medida y además ofreciendo servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen personal y profesional de su clientela. Así fue como al día de hoy, ha logrado tener un salón de belleza y una miscelánea o punto comercial donde exhibe sus productos y también una vivienda de su propiedad. Este avance no ha sido por cuenta del destino, pues ella ha trabajado fuertemente, en horarios extendidos  desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche y todos los días sin cesar, para lograrlo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mercancías variadas y útiles escolares, aprovechando que la temporada educativa genera picos altos en la venta de estos artículos. Con esta inversión el surtido mejorará y con ello se impactarán las ventas en su negocio, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa. Su meta más adelante es ampliar su miscelánea y hacer mejoramiento a su vivienda, con el fin de aumentar la imagen de calidad de su negocio y lograr atraer mas clientes.
texts.en:
Five years ago, Gina who lives with her spouse and 5 children aged between 11 and 17 years old. decided to start a commercial activity to make money and help her husband manage the well-being of the family. She started selling products by catalog or specialized guides of different articles and little by little grew, adding to what she offered what her clientele needed made to order for them. She also offers personal and professional service image improvement services to her clients.

That is how today she has a beauty salon and a general store or sales point where she displays her products and also a house on her property. This improvement did not happen by chance she worked very hard with long hours from 7 in the morning until 7 in the evening every day without stopping to achieve this.

Currently she is applying for a loan from Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo with which she will buy a variety of merchandise and school supplies, taking advantage of the school term's high sales periods of these items. With this investment her inventory will grow and this will have an impact on her sales in her business which will make it a successful investment.

Her goal later on is to expand her general goods sales and make improvements to her house with the aim of raising the image of quality of her business and manage to attract more clients.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise and school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sacks of cereals to warehouse and resell later on

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric and accessories like thread, elastic, buttons, brooches, needles, etc. in order to make clothing.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosanna is 47 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Rosanna has a business buying and selling nipa in the Philippines. Rosanna requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock of nipa to sell.

Rosanna has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Rosanna would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of nipa to sell

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 22-year-old single man from the city of Dier Al-Balah city. He lives with his family in a small house. 

Five months ago, Anwar started his own business, which is transferring goods using his rickshaw. It is a good business and supports the family with a good income.

Anwar took a USD murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the remaining cost of his new rickshaw. This will help Anwar to pay part of his urgent expenses.

Anwar appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the remaining cost of his new rickshaw.

loans.name: Salman

texts.en:
Salman is a 26-year-old single man from the city of Dier Al-Balah. He lives with his family in a small house. Two years ago, Salman started his own business, which is transferring goods using his rickshaw. It is a good business and supports the family with a good income.

Salman took a USD murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to replace the old one. This will help Salman to increase his income and productivity.

Salman appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to replace the old one.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 39 years old, married and has two children. She is a vendor selling vegetables to the people in her village. She uses her income for meals and bills at home. She hopes to have a continuous supply of good quality vegetables for her business; therefore, she is asking for a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy eggplant, cabbages and tomatoes to sell. Someday she hopes to improve her sales and continuously offer good products and friendly service as well.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, cabbages and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is 48 years old, married, and has school-aged children. She is managing a piggery, and she raise hogs for sale. She also manages a farming business. She has insufficient funds to sustain her hogs; therefore, she is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs. She will also use part of her loan to maintain her farming business. She will use additional revenue to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane has a child. She is 31 years old and married. Her family lives at Amulung.

She is cooking and selling snacks to sell to the people in her village. She cooks fish balls, kikiam, and hot dogs to sell. She wanted to increase her earnings, that is why she is asking for a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy more hot dogs, fish balls, and grocery items to sell. She wants to continue managing her business and to make it more profitable for added revenues.

She will save the profits for education and revolving capital in her business.

loans.use: to buy more hot dogs, fish balls, and grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 46 years old, married, and has five children. She is a vendor selling vegetables and grocery items.

She is very eager to gain income for her family’s sustenance, especially for education purposes. She wants to increase her profits and needs additional capital in buying grocery items to sell. She is now asking for additional capital of 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, biscuits, soap, and shampoo to sell in her store.

Someday, Valentina hopes to keep achieving good sales and keep funds for her family’s emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, soap, and shampoo to sell in her store.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is a married woman with seven children, two of whom are in school. She is 52 years old. Lucresia is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lucresia has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Lucresia requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional nipa leaves and other inputs to use in her business.

Lucresia has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Lucresia would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional nipa leaves

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 32 years old and married, with one child in school. Nida works very hard to provide for her family.

Nida runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, biscuits, and other groceries.

Nida has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Nida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, biscuits, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 45 ans, Ama est une femme qui vit à Agbokopé avec ses cinq enfants. Ama vend de la boisson locale communément appelée Tchoukoutchou préparée à base du mil. Ama s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché d’Assiyéyé. Pour acheter des sacs de mil et les ingrédients nécessaires pour sa préparation, Ama demande ce microcrédit pour financer sa commande et faire plus de revenus.
texts.en:
Married and aged 45, Ama is a woman who lives in Agbokopé with her five children. Ama sells local brew, commonly known as Tchoukoutchou, prepared from a base of millet. She stocks up four times a month at the market in Assiyéyé. 

In order to buy some sacks of millet and necessary ingredients for her brew, Ama is asking for this small loan to finance her order and make more income.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of millet and necessary ingredients for her brew

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Jenefer works hard to support her family. She has a retail coconut wine business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from nipa roofing (nipa is a type of palm). Jenefer is borrowing 6000 PHP through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), to buy containers of coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine business. Jenefer has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.ru: Махфират 44 летняя жительница района Бохтар. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Махфират талантливая  и шустрая женщина. Она занимается шитьем женской одежды уже более 15 лет. Махфират шьет национальную и разную одежду. Она с семьей строят дом, но из-за нехватки денежных средств не смогли закончить строительство. Сейчас Махфират хочет взять кредит и завершить строительство. На заемные средства она купить строй материалы. У нее есть только один выход, взять кредит. Ей нужна Ваша помощь.
texts.en: Mahfirat is a 44-year old woman living in  the Bohtar Region. She is married and has three children. Mahfirat is a talented and energetic person. For over 15 years she has been sewing women’s clothing. She sews traditional clothing as well as other types of clothing. She and her family are in the middle of  building a house, but so far lack the funds to complete the construction work. Mahfirat would like to take out a loan to finish the construction. She will use her loan to buy construction materials. Taking out a loan is her only option. She needs your help.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and finish building her house.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 23-year-old married man from Deir El Balah city. He lives with his wife and a son in a small house. Mahmoud decided to start his own business by buying a new rickshaw. He can transfer goods between the wholesalers and traders.

Mahmoud took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy the new rickshaw and start working with it. This will improve the family's living conditions.

Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw and start working with it

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 40 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Marilou works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, biscuits, groceries, etc.

Marilou has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, biscuits, groceries, etc

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth works at a restaurant as a waitress and she also give her services at a church Elizabeth needs a loan to pay the construction of a retaining wall Elizabeth is the single mother of 2 children She is alone and she hopes you can help her In the picture Elizabeth appears with her kids.
texts.en: Elizabeth works at a restaurant as a waitress and also works at a church.  She needs a loan to pay for construction of a retaining wall.  She is the single mother of 2 children.  She is alone and hopes you can help her.  In the picture above Elizabeth is shown with her children.

loans.use: to build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Rosas De San Jose 1 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE SAN JOSE 1” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jimena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de pescado, venta de ropa, venta de maíz, venta de condimentos, venta de muebles, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jimena es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de condimentos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de su pareja, quien trabaja con el mismo negocio, es por ello que guardo un capital pequeño para iniciar un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de condimentos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la frontera de Perú – Bolivia y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene una hija.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Rosas de San Jose 1" group will begin their sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional hub.  The group is made up of eight members and is managed by a board of directors with Jimena as president.  The members are engaged in a variety of businesses, including sales of food, fish, clothing corn, condiments, and furniture. 

The loan will benefit micro-business-people, including Jimena.  She says she started with Pro Mujer five years ago, having joined on the invitation of a friend who is a client at the institution.  Jimena currently has a business selling condiments.  She let us know that she learned the business some years ago from her partner, who works there too, which is why she's saving up a bit of capital to start an independent business.  
 
Jimena will use this loan to increase capital.  She'll buy condiments wholesale from wholesalers on the Perú-Bolivia border and then sell them at her sales locale.  Working this way allows her to have the means to support her family financially; she lives with her partner and has a daughter.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Jimena responds that she likes the training the they offer.

loans.use: to buy condiments wholesale.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer earns a living by selling various used items such as bags, shoes, sandals, and slippers. 

Jennifer is a full-fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, and she enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow cinder blocks to complete her house's kitchen which she has almost finished. 

Jennifer hopes to be able to live comfortably and wishes nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow cinder blocks to complete her kitchen.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is both a hardworking mother and businesswoman. 

Elizabeth has requested a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, which she will use to increase her store's inventory. She will buy additional grocery items such as basic commodities. 

This loan will allow Elizabeth to sell more goods, earn more income, and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items and commodities to increase her store's inventory.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Maria is 65 years old now.

Maria has a nipa (woven palm frond shingle) roofing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like bamboo sticks, etc.

Maria has been in this business for 35 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like bamboo sticks, etc.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis is 55 years old and she sells hot dogs in the city of La Paz She has a little stand Gladis is a brave entrepreneur she wants a loan to offer fruit juices and other kind of food to her customers She is convinced she will make more money so she hopes you can help her. Gladis is the mother of 2 kids she is not married but she will give her best effort
texts.en:
Gladis is 55 years old and she sells hot dogs in the city of La Paz. She has a small stand. Gladis is a brave entrepreneur who wants a loan to offer fruit juices and various kinds of food to her customers. 

Gladis, the mother of two children, is convinced that she can make more money and she hopes you can help her. Gladis is not married and she will put forth her best effort.

loans.use: to offer fruit juices and other kinds of food to her customers

loans.name: Sadbarg

texts.ru: Садбарг 43 лет. Она проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе вместе мужем и детьми. Муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, по той причине что он не нашел себе работу в стране. Садбарг  работает специалистом в телевидении уже 10 лет. Ей нравится своя работа. Садбарг берет кредит, чтобы отремонтировать дом. Она работает и старается обеспечить детей всем. У нее нет больше денег для ремонта, по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Ей очень нужна Ваша помощь. Садбарг верит в Вас и надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Sadbarg is 43 years old. She lives in the town of Qurgan-Tube with her husband and children. Her husband works in the Russian Federation because he could not find work in his own country. Sadbarg has been working as a television specialist for 10 years. She likes her work. Sadbarg is requesting this loan to repair her house. She works and tries to provide her children with everything. She does not have anymore money for the repairs and this is why she requested this loan. She really needs Your help. Sadbarg believes in You and hopes for Your support.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and repair her house

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria has a retailing business, selling various clothing and footwear. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC, and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance.

Gloria has always dreamed of living in a durable, concrete house for her family, for which she has availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of cement and loads of sand and floor tiles for her house completion. She is on her way to finishing her house.

She hopes to live comfortably and wishes nothing more than to have a happy life and adequate income from her business to sufficiently provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and loads of sand and floor tiles for her house completion.

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Это Мадина. Ей 38 лет. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Мадина вместе детьми проживает в районе Бохтар. Ее муж находится за границей, чтобы зарабатывать на жизнь. Мадина сама занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности и пчеловодством. В сельскохозяйственной деятельности она сажает разные овощи. Можно сказать, что земледелие является основной источникам дохода, потому что доход от этого бизнеса обеспечивает семью.  Доход от бизнеса она тратиться на расходы, по этой причине она не смогла копить больше денег. Мадина  хочет отремонтировать дом, но  ей не хватает денежных средств, для приобретения стройматериалов. Поэтому она запрашивает кредит. Поддержите ей достичь своих целей.
texts.en: This is Madina. She is 38 years old. She is married and a mother of three children. Madina and her children live in the Bohtar district. Her husband earns a living abroad. Madina is involved in an agricultural business and beekeeping. For her agricultural business, she plants various vegetables. It can be said that farming is her primary source of income because the earnings from this business provide for the family. She spends the business income on expenses and hence could not save more money. Madina wants to repair her house, but does not have enough money to buy construction materials. This is why she is requesting this loan. Please support her in achieving her goals.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and repair her house

loans.name: Hildalyn

texts.en:
Hildalyn is a businesswoman in Ozamiz. She is 39 years old, married and a microfinance member of PMPC. Hildalyn runs a sari-sari (small grocery) store. Running this type of business has supported her family in addition to her husband's income, especially in the education of her children. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase more store inventory and other consumable items. Hildalyn believes having enough inventory would allow her to cater to her customers' needs. She is thankful that she has signed up for membership with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to purchase more store inventory and other consumable items

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda makes a living through her retailing business. She runs a store and earns a promising income, enabling her to support her husband in raising their family. She has signed up her membership with PMPC to gain access to capitalization and insurances. 

She wants to increase her inventory, and so she has availed herself of a loan to purchase more store inventories for retail sale. Emelda hopes to sustain her business and from there provide good living conditions for all of those in the family.

loans.use: to purchase more store inventory for retail sale

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mila works hard to support her family.

She has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from coconut wine vending. Mila is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed such as bamboo sticks, etc. for her nipa roofing business.

Mila has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed such as bamboo sticks, etc.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Basilisa is 47 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Basilisa has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials such as bamboo sticks, etc.

Basilisa has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials such as bamboo sticks, etc.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 42 years old and married with four children.

Zenaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Zenaida has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from nipa roofing.

Zenaida aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат проживает в городке под названием Турсунзода. Города был назван в честь великого писателя современника Мирзо Турсунзода. Малохат годится тем, что живет в этом городе. Малохат замужем и имеет двоих детей. Дочке 18 лет она учится. Сыну 21 год, он помогает родителям в работе. Малохат с мужем имеют пекарню, где пекут лепешки. Этот бизнес они обосновали 4 года назад. Малохат обратилась за кредитом, потому что хочет расширить деятельность и увеличить доход. За счет кредита она приобретет муху, масло дрожжей, остальные компоненты и дрова. Малахат обратилась за кредитом, потому что МДО "Хумо" поддерживает клиентов женщин и создает им более выгодные условия кредитования. Малохат надеется, что ей смогут предоставить кредит.
texts.en: Malohat lives in a town by the name of Tursun-zoda. The town was named after the great contemporary writer Mirzo Tursunzoda. Malohat is proud that she lives in this town. Malohat is married and has two children. Her daughter is 18 years old and she is studying. Her son is 21 years old, and he is helping his parents with work. Malohat and her husband have a bakery, where they bake flatbread. They started this business 4 years ago. Malohat requested this loan because she wants to expand her business and increase her income. She will use this loan to buy flour, butter, yeast, additional ingredients and wood. Malohat requested the loan because MDO Humo supports women clients and provides them with advantageous lending terms. Malohat hopes that she will be given the loan.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, yeast, additional ingredients and wood

loans.name: Ledilina

texts.en:
Ledilina is 56 years old, married, and a resident of Poblacion, La Libertad, Philippines. Her husband is a manual laborer. They are blessed with 3 children. 

Because it is hard for them to survive if only her husband is working, Ledilina decided to engage herself in her own business. She started a sari-sari, or mini-grocery store, with 1,500 PHP in capital. Their primary customers are their neighbors. She has been able to manage the business successfully and finance the daily needs of her family, with help from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative of which she became a member in April 2012. 

Ledilina was able to take 2 loans, and she has repaid them religiously. Now, she is applying for a loan of 4,400 PHP to finance the purchase of additional inventory for her sari-sari store. 

Ledilina is looking forward to expanding her sari-sari into a mini-mart someday.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her sari-sari grocery store.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en: Pedro is 52 years old and lives in Amulung. He manages a hog-raising business for income. He has been in his business for four years now. He wants to ensure healthy growth of his hogs but has insufficient funds: this is why he is asking for a loan of P8,000 to buy feed for his hogs' sustenance. This will nourish his hogs for healthier growth. Pedro hopes to save funds for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy feed for his hogs' sustenance

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
Rema is a 58-year-old, married woman from Bethlehem city. She is a mother of three sons and one daughter. 

Rema has a small workshop where she makes crafts from olive wood. She makes religious gifts and she sells them in her stall or exports them outside of Palestine.

Rema took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help her to buy raw wood for her workshop. This will help her to prepare a new collection for Easter. This will increase her productivity and also her income.

Rema appears in the photo while she was working.

loans.use: to buy raw wood for her workshop.

loans.name: Caselda

texts.en:
Caselda, 55, is married, with five adult-age children. 

Her major source of income is farming. She has been in this business for ten years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children, until they graduated and got jobs. 

Caselda is still continuing the business because it provides good income, due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her farm and yield more produce. 

To realize her project, she availed herself of a loan to purchase fruit-bearing seedlings. Someday, she hopes to purchase a parcel of land to cultivate.

loans.use: to purchase fruit-bearing seedlings.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nora is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Nora has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. Nora has requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

Nora has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, Nora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Kisubba Women's Group

texts.en: John whose hand is raised up in the group is a 40-year-old married Man with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He deals in cocoa buying and selling in Bundibugyo. He sells to a leading cocoa company called ESCO and is proud of his business because it has enabled him to sustain her family. He hopes to increase on his output although the hardship of unpredictable weather changes is a hindrance to his business. John will use the loan to buy cocoa for selling.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jocelyn has a nipa-roofing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy materials like bamboo sticks.

Jocelyn has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like bamboo sticks.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 55 years old and has three adult sons. She is living alone right now. Miriam is a divorced woman who receives a disability payment. She cooks pastries and sells them on the streets to earn some money. Her products are also offered to several stores.

Miriam wants a loan to pay medical expenses since her former husband is not able to provide much help. She wants to be healthy because she needs to work.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses.

loans.name: Awawou

texts.fr: Awawou est une femme mariée âgée de 30 ans  qui vit à Adakpamé avec son mari et son enfant. Awawou participe activement à la survie de sa famille en vendant des laitues assaisonnées de fruits et de spaghettis pour ses clients. Awawou s’approvisionne deux fois par mois. Pour acheter des légumes et des fruits, Awawou sollicite ce crédit pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser des bénéfices pouvant lui permettre de contribuer à la vie quotidienne de sa famille.
texts.en:
