Awawou is 30 years old, married, and lives in Adakpamé with her husband and child. She makes an active contribution to the household income by selling fruit, spaghetti and dressed lettuce to customers.

Awawou buys her supplies twice a month at the grand market. She is requesting this loan so she can buy fruit and vegetables and thereby contribute to supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy four boxes of spaghetti, three jars of mayonnaise and four tins of sardines.

loans.name: Donga

texts.fr: Agée de 55 ans, Donga est une femme mariée qui vit à Avépozo avec ses quatre enfants. Pour favoriser l’éducation et la nutrition de ses enfants, Donga vend de la boisson locale communément appelée Tchoukoutchou préparée à base du mil. Donga s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des sacs de mil et les ingrédients nécessaires pour sa préparation, Donga demande ce microcrédit pour financer sa commande et faire plus de revenus.
texts.en:
Donga is 55 years old, married, and lives in Avépozo with her four children. 

To pay for her children's food and education, Donga sells a local drink prepared from millet, known as Tchoukoutchou. She buys her supplies twice a month at the  market. 

She is requesting this microloan so she can buy the bags of millet and other ingredients needed to prepare the drink. It will help her make more money.

loans.use: to buy four bags of millet.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Etant une femme au foyer et agée de 33 ans, Afi vit avec ses quatre enfants dans le quartier Adamavo à Lomé. Elle coud des habits pour ainsi subvenir aux besoins du foyer. Afi s’approvisionne au grand marché deux fois par semaine. Afi est dynamique et a une bonne rentabilité dans son activité génératrice de revenu. Afi sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des pagnes et tissus pour faire les habits de bons modèles et réaliser encore plus de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Afi is 33 years old and a housewife. She lives with her four children in the Adamavo district of Lomé.

Afi works as a seamstress to provide for her family. She buys her supplies in the grand market twice a week.

Afi is hardworking and makes a good profit from her business. She is requesting this loan to buy traditional cloth pagnes and fabrics so she can make well-designed outfits and further increase her revenue.

loans.use: to buy five lengths of fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to raise his capital to buy many cases of beer to resell for profit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetic products such as body lotions, soaps, and beauty creams.

loans.name: Alba Lucia

texts.es:
Una cafetería represento para la señora Alba una verdadera salvación a sus 46 años de edad es una madre cabeza de familia tiene dos hijas de 16 y 8 años de edad las cuales protege y hace lo posible para darles una buena calidad de vida, como quedarse largas jornadas para ganar un poco más de capital.
Alba quiere seguir con su profesión esa que la saco de la desesperación en tiempos difíciles, la sostenibilidad del negocio es algo que siempre la mantiene muy preocupada.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido en bebidas como refrescos, cervezas, productos comestibles como palitos de queso, pasteles de pollo, emparedados, tortas de carne, productos de panadería, frituras, dulces entro otros.
texts.en:
A cafeteria represents a true salvation for Sra. Alba. She is a 46-year-old mother who is the head of her family. Alba has two daughters, ages 16 and 8, who she protects and strives to provide a good quality of life. She works long days in order to earn a bit more capital.

Alba wants to continue her profession so that she can avoid the despair felt during difficult times. Sustaining her business is something that always worries her. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a stock of beverages, such as soft drinks and beer, as well as food such as cheese sticks, chicken pastries, sandwiches, beef sandwiches, baked goods, fried foods, sweets, and other items.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beer, cheese sticks, chicken pastries, sandwiches, beef sandwiches, fried foods, sweets, and other items.

loans.name: Ikiraro Group

texts.fr:
Polycarpe fait partie du groupe  Ikiraro  et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 37 ans et est marié à Shella, une infirmière .Ensemble ils ont 2  enfants l’un a 2 ans et l’autre 3 ans.

Il  fait le commerce  de bananes depuis  3 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une  grande quantité   de bananes à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  avoir sa propre maison  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Polycarp is part of the Ikiraro group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 37 years old and is married to Shella, a nurse. They have 2 children aged 2 and 3 years old. 

He has had a banana business for 3 years. 

This is Polycarp's second loan with Turame. With this Kiva Loan, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to sell in order to earn more.

loans.use: to buy a large number of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: This is Mildred, a farmer of butternuts, arrow roots, sweet potatoes and carrots. She is married with five children. Through farming she has been able to take care of her family and educate her children. She sells her produce at her local market. Unfortunately, the stock is not adequate and with a Kiva loan she will be able to increase her stock by buying from her neighbors.

loans.use: to pay for stock in her business

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella, aged 39 years, is a married woman with four children, ages 21, 18, 15 and 12. She comes from cell B, Ishaka Division, Bushenyi District.

This is her sixth loan cycle with Ugafode. She operates a retail shop for 10 hours a day. She started the retail shop in 2001, and since then, she has never looked back because of the fact that she has no alternative source of income. 

All of her four children are school-going, and so she has to employ workers when her children are at school, and when they are back from school, they help her with the selling in the retail shop and work with her and learn business skills. She started this business to earn a living, and it was also a husband’s decision to start up a business for her. 

She is borrowing 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy more stock for the retail business. Her clients are people from all walks of life. She hopes to build a better house with the support of her husband for her children, since now the family is in a two-room house. She is limited by lack of enough capital to add in her business, but since the institution has given her some help, she hopes to increase her stock and meet the demands of her clients. 

She is an honest and a shrewd woman who is so loyal to the institution and pays on her due date.

loans.use: to increase stock for her retail business

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: This is Michael, a dairy farmer who is diligent in rearing cows. He is married with four children. As a young child, he used to assist his family in the farm and loved taking care of the cows. This experience is what assisted him to set out to do dairy farming for himself. The produce from the dairy cows he sells to co-operatives and with that income he is able to support his family and pay school fees for his children. He wants to increase his milk supply and with a KIVA Loan he will be able to purchase another dairy cow.

loans.use: to pay for one dairy cow

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
NB:Il y a trois hommes parmi les membres dans le groupe c'est le profil de un de ces  hommes qui a été pris celui de Mousa.  Mousa est l’homme assis et qui a le bélier juste devant lui par devant.
Mousa est un éleveur de moutons Malien, âgé de  50 ans, réside  au Mali, marié, et père de 5 enfants, les enfants ont été scolarisés tous, mais ont abandonné au profit des travaux champêtres. Il n’a pas été à l’école. Il habite dans la même localité avec  sa femme qui fait le ménage. Mousa faisait le stockage et arrivé a un moment donné il changea son activité en élevage. Il a 11 ans expériences dans l’élevage.  Il s’approvisionne en moutons dans les différentes  foires locales et les revend dans les mêmes foires. Il emprunte avec RMCR, cela  lui a permis d’accroitre le nombre de ses animaux pour l’élevage. Les bénéfices de l’embouche sont utilisés pour couvrir les charges de la famille et le matériel agricole.
texts.en:
Note: Though this group is made up of mostly women, this profile is of one of the three male group members.
Mousa is the man sitting down with the ram just in front of him. Mousa is a 50 year old sheep breeder living in Mali. He is married and a father to 5 children, who have all been in school, but left in favor of a rural lifestyle. Mousa never went to school. He lives in the same community with his wife, who takes care of the housework. Mousa was working in storage until one day he changed his business to breeding. He has 11 years of experience breeding livestock. He acquires his sheep at the various local trade fairs and resells them in the same fairs. He takes loans with RMCR, which allows him to increase the number of his livestock for breeding. The profits from livestock are used to cover the family's expenses and farming equipment.

loans.use: To buy sheep to raise and sell.

loans.name: Latifa

texts.ru: Латифе 46 лет. Она проживает в маленьком городке под названием Турсунзода. Города был назван в честь великого писателя современника Мирзо Турсунзода. Латифа годится тем, что живет в этом городе. У Латифы большая семья, состоящая из мужа, четверых детей, троих невесток и троих внуков. Ее муж также с ней занимается животноводством и на ровне ухаживают, кормят скотов. Латифа с мужем хотят увеличить доходность от бизнеса путем увеличения поголовья скотов. Латифа сама обратилась за кредитом, потому что МДО "Хумо" поддерживает клиентов женщин и создает им более выгодные условия кредитования. Латифа верит, что сможет получить кредит, и они с мужем расширить свой малый бизнес.
texts.en:
Latifa is 46. She lives in a small city called Tursun-zoda, which was named in honour of the great writer Mirzo Tursun-zoda. She is proud to live in this city. She has a large family, consisting of her husband, four children, three of their spouses and three grandchildren. Her husband works in animal husbandry with her and helps care for and feed the livestock.

Latifa and her husband want to increase the revenue from their business by increasing their head count of livestock. She approached Humo for a loan because they support women and give them better loan conditions. She believes that she will be able to receive a loan and that she and her husband will be able to expand their small business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and expand her business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 71-year-old widower who lives alone. He receives a retirement payment, but he also drives a taxi to earn more money because he has many expenses.

Samuel needs a loan to buy a new engine for his taxi. He wants to save money in order to finish the construction of his house. Right now he is living in a tiny room that is not comfortable.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his taxi.

loans.name: Cjfdt 17 Group

texts.fr: CJFDT 17 est un sous groupe affilié à la Convergence des Jeunes et Femmes pour le Développement de Tassette(village situé à plus de 20 km de la ville ou se situe le guichet). Il est composé de 05 femmes qui habitent toutes dans le même village et qui font pratiquement les mêmes activités. Elles évoluent dans l'élevage et la vente de lait. MAME DIARRA est leur présidente. C'est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo, elle est mariée et mère de famille qui aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans et demande ce montant pour acheter des moutons et chèvres, pour les élever, et traire le lait afin de pouvoir le vendre et satisfaire ses besoins personnels. Elle commence sa journée à 06 h du matin pour la terminer à 17h. Elle voudrait avoir une boutique à la marché centrale de la ville afin de pouvoir augmenter et diversifier ses produits pour avoir plus de revenu et épargner de l'argent. Ainsi elle pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
CJFDT stands for the "Convergence des Jeunes et Femmes pour le Développement de Tassette," i.e. the "convergence of youth and women for the development of Tassette." CJFDT is composed of 5 women who all live in the same village and who participate in nearly the same activities. They operate in the breeding and sale of milk. 
Mame Diarra is their President. She is the one raising her hand in the photo. She is married and a mother who helps her husband in managing daily expenses and her children's school fees. She has over 10 years of experience in her field of work, and asks for this amount to buy sheep and goats to raise and milk. She plans to sell the milk in order to sell it to pay for personal expenses. Mame Diarra starts her day at 6 am and finishes at 17h . She would like someday to have a shop in the central market of the city with increased and diverse products for more income and improved living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats to raise them and sell their milk.

loans.name: Cjfdt 27 Group

texts.fr:
CFJDT 27 est un sous groupe affilié à la Convergence des Femmes et Jeunes pour le Développement de Tassette. Il est composé de 05 personnes dont 4 femmes et un homme qui habitent tous dans le même village de Tassette qui est à quelques kilomètres de la ville ou se situe le Guichet. Ils se réunissent tous les fins de mois et organisent des tontines. Leur présidente s'appelle Madama AWA qui est une femme mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des céréales comme le mil, le maïs, le sorgho et les haricots qui sont cultivés sur place. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter ces céréales, les stocker et attende la période de soudure (pendant la sécheresse) pour les revendre sur la marché
Elle a une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans cette activité et commence sa journée à 7h pour les terminer à 19h. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle souhaite ouvrir une grande boutique d'alimentation générale pour diversifier et augmenter ses revenus. Ainsi elle pourra épargner de l'argent.
texts.en:
CFJDT 27 is a sub-group which is affiliated to the Convergence of Women and Youths for the Development of Tassette. It is made up of five people, four women and one man, who all live in the same village of Tassette, which is several kilometers from the town where the branch lies. They meet up at the end of every month to organise "tontines" (revolving finance systems where each member contributes periodically an agreed amount and this is passed on in rotation to different members). 

Their president is called Awa, and she is a married woman and a mother. She is developing a business selling cereals such as millet, corn, sorghum and beans, which are all grown locally. She is requesting this loan to buy cereals, stock them and wait for the period when there are food shortages (during the drought) to resell them at the market. She has more than 20 years experience in this business and begins her day at 7 o'clock in the morning, finishing at 7 o'clock in the evening. She helps out her husband with the daily outgoings and her children's school fees. She would like to open a large grocery store in order to diversify and increase her income. By doing this she will be able to save money.

loans.use: to buy cereals for stocking and reselling during the period when there are food shortages.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children who all go to school. Lydia sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 8 years, working six days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. Her major challenge includes defaulters and seasonality. She joined MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care from the loan officers. Lydia aspires to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include food and rent.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Meet Ann. She is a small-scale farmer from Kapsowar, a rural town known for dairy farming. Ann has a husband, and they are blessed with a lovely family whom she has fought so hard to raise.

For the past 10 years, Ann has been actively involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been milk and maize farming. She sells her produce to the nearby market and also to neighbors, and has been making positive strides.

Ann wants to diversify and she is seeking a loan to start sheep farming and be able to make her dream come true. She is very passionate about sheep farming, and the most enjoyable task is raising the sheep. Sheep farming is a very profitable business venture, and the demand for sheep meat (mutton) is always high, being such a popular meal for many people in Kapsowar. Ann will also benefit from sheep wool which fetches a high price both in international and domestic markets. Additional profits from sheep farming will change her life, and she will be able to take care of the family expenses.

loans.use: to start sheep farming.
